title: 3 bed mews for sale Lawnhurst Avenue, Manchester M23
about_property:
****viewings to commence from 5th September 2025*****
Modern townhouse style home
No onward chain
Convenient reach to metrolink, retail parks and commuter links
Three bedrooms
Three bathrooms
Driveway and garage
Enclosed rear garden
Description
Modern three bedroom town house style home positioned within the popular Lawnhurst development, ideally located for the nearby Metrolink, Wythenshawe Hospital and M56/M60 motorway links.
In brief the property comprises; entrance hallway, cloakroom/cupboard providing storage space, shower room, bedroom three and access to integral garage. The first floor provides a well-proportioned living room, modern fitted kitchen with integrated oven, hob, extractor and space for dining table and chairs. The second floor provides two further double bedrooms both with en-suite facilities. Externally to the front there is a driveway providing off road parking and access to the garage. The rear garden is enclosed by timber fenced boundaries. Call now to view!
Location
Lawnhurst Avenue is an extremely popular place to live, thanks to easy transport links into Media City, Manchester City Centre and other neighbouring areas via Metrolink stations. The nearby North West motorway network and Manchester International Airport are also conveniently located nearby. Sale and the surrounding areas are also very desirable locations for families, due to the large number of highly regarded schools in the vicinity. Both Sale and Altrincham located nearby can also provide for all shopping and recreational needs and one of Europe's largest shopping centres, The Trafford Centre can be found only a few miles away. Timperley village meets the needs of its local residents with butchers, bakers, coffee shops and convenience stores. The restoration and refurbishment of the historic Altrincham Market Quarter has given the town a modern edge, providing a new gastro style hub for visitors and locals, alongside the construction of Altrincham General Hospital, a superb, modern health facility for Trafford residents. Trafford is renowned for its excellent educational facilities, priding itself on being home to some of the most reputable primary and secondary schools, whilst a number of parks and recreational areas cater for the needs of families with children of all ages.

Services have not been tested and you are advised to make your own enquiries and/or inspections.

title: 6 bed detached house for sale Manchester Old Road, Middleton, Manchester M24
address: Manchester Old Road, Middleton, Manchester M24
about_property:
*** new instruction, must be viewed ***
6 bedrooms, 4 reception rooms and 5 bathrooms
An outstanding, fully renovated family home
Off road parking for multiple vehicles
Beautifully landscaped rear garden
Freehold
Over 5,000 sq ft across four floors
No onwards chain
Easy access to motorway links and manchester city centre
Period features found throughout
Hunters are proud to present this exceptional six-bedroom detached substantial Victorian villa, believed to have been built circa 1860 by the Apsell Family, owners of the former Tonge Mill. The residence is perfectly positioned opposite Limefield Park on the sought-after Manchester Old Road and less than 3 minutes walk to Alkrington Woods Nature Reserve which offers over 120 acres of mature woodland, meadows, rivers and fishing lodges.
Thoughtfully restored and redesigned by the current owners, the home exemplifies superior craftsmanship and attention to detail throughout. Offered with no chain and freehold tenure, this distinctive property seamlessly blends period features with high-quality modern upgrades and expansive, beautifully maintained grounds — an ideal home for large or growing families.
Upon entering, a grand hallway with original flooring and high ceilings sets a welcoming tone. Two elegant front reception rooms, both bathed in natural light from large bay windows and side windows featuring original wooden shutters, offer ideal spaces for entertaining or relaxing. Continuing through the hallway, you'll find a spacious dining room with traditional wooden flooring, perfect for hosting large gatherings.
The ground floor also boasts a well-equipped kitchen and breakfast area, complete with premium appliances, which connects to a separate, self-contained annex. This additional living space includes a second kitchen, bathroom, lounge and a double bedroom — ideal for extended family or guests. The annex is easily separated / combined into the main residence with two lockable internal doors.
A stylish garden room at the rear of the property overlooks the garden, while a convenient downstairs WC completes the ground floor.
Upstairs, the traditional landing leads to five large bedrooms. The standout master suite features a duplex design, with a spiral staircase leading to a private upper level that includes a lounge (with ideal work from home office space), bathroom featuring twin bathtubs, and separate shower room — perfect for modern living.
A spacious family bathroom, a Jack & Jill shower room, and an en-suite to one of the bedrooms ensure convenience and comfort for all.
For added versatility, the property includes a large basement divided into three rooms — offering excellent potential for conversion into games / entertainment spaces or an additional self-contained living space.
Additionally, a separate log cabin, currently used as an exercise studio and office, benefits from a shower & WC, electricity and ethernet connections.
Outside, the rear garden offers a private oasis, tastefully landscaped with a mix of lawn and decking, and includes a hot tub area. The front of the property features a large driveway providing ample off-road parking.
Ideally located in a popular residential area, this home offers easy access to local amenities, well-regarded schools, motorway links, Heaton Park, and is just around 7 miles from Manchester City Centre.
Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the scale, charm, and outstanding potential of this unique family home.

title: 3 bed flat for sale Broomleigh, Booth Road, Altrincham WA14
about_property:
Impressive duplex apartment
Convenient reach of altrincham centre and dunham massey
One undercroft parking space and second upper level space
Wonderful proportions
Master bedroom with five piece en-suite
Three reception rooms
Three bedrooms
Two bathrooms
Generous kitchen diner
Share of the freehold
A substantial and beautifully presented duplex apartment spanning just over 2,300 sq ft, set on the second floor of a highly sought-after development near Altrincham town centre and Dunham Massey National Trust Park.
The versatile accommodation includes three generous reception rooms, a spacious kitchen/diner, two bedrooms on the lower level, one with an en-suite, and a family bathroom. Upstairs, there is a large third bedroom offering additional flexibility.
Set within mature communal grounds, the property also benefits from one undercroft parking space and a second above-ground space. Viewing is essential to fully appreciate the space and setting on offer.
Description
Set within one of Altrincham's extremely desirable and prestigious developments, this exceptional duplex-style apartment occupies a prime second-floor position and offers over 2,300 sq ft of beautifully proportioned, versatile accommodation. A rare opportunity, this property combines impressive scale with refined living in a highly convenient setting, just moments from Altrincham town centre and the natural beauty of Dunham Massey National Trust Park.
The apartment unfolds over two expansive levels, with the lower duplex floor offering a superb flow of space. A welcoming hallway leads to three generous reception rooms, each offering flexibility for formal dining, home working, or relaxed family living. The spacious kitchen/diner is perfectly suited for entertaining, with ample room for casual dining and day-to-day living.
Also on this level are two well-appointed bedrooms, including a principal suite with a private en-suite bathroom, while a further stylish main bathroom serves the second bedroom and guests alike.
A staircase rises to the upper duplex level, where a good size third bedroom awaits; an ideal guest suite, additional lounge, or creative space, depending on your needs.
Externally, the development is enveloped by mature, well-maintained communal grounds, offering a peaceful and green outlook throughout the seasons. The apartment benefits from two private parking spaces, one secure undercroft space, and a second above-ground bay, ensuring convenience and security.
Whether you're seeking a substantial home in a prime location, a lock-up-and-leave base, or simply wish to enjoy the rare luxury of space and elegance in a prestigious setting, this outstanding apartment is certain to impress. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the scale, setting, and lifestyle this property affords.
Location
The transformation of Altrincham Town Centre has taken a major step forward, with new proposals set to revitalise the area. The regeneration of the Transport Interchange has improved accessibility both in and out of the town, whilst maintaining excellent connections to wider regions including Manchester City Centre and Manchester Airport. Larger retailers can be found at Altrincham Retail Park just a short drive from the Town Centre and one of the largest shopping centres in Europe, The Trafford Centre is only a few miles away. Hale village on the other hand meets the needs of its local residents with butchers, bakers, coffee shops and convenience stores. The restoration and refurbishment of the historic Altrincham Market Quarter has given the town a modern edge, providing a new gastro style hub for visitors and locals, alongside the construction of Altrincham General Hospital, a superb, modern health facility for Trafford residents. Trafford is renowned for its excellent educational facilities, priding itself on being home to some of the most reputable primary and secondary schools, whilst a number of parks and recreational areas cater for the needs of families with children of all ages.

Share Of Freehold
Service charges approximately £4,500 per annum
Services (Not Tested)
Services have not been tested and you are advised to make your own enquiries and/or inspections.

Viewing strictly by appointment through the Agents.

display_address: Little Stones Road, Egerton, Bolton BL7
title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale Little Stones Road, Egerton, Bolton BL7
address: Little Stones Road, Egerton, Bolton BL7
about_property:
Tucked away on a quiet cul-de-sac in the sought-after village of Egerton, this deceptively spacious three-storey semi offers far more living space than your average semi-detached home. Recently upgraded with a brand-new kitchen and new roof in 2024, it combines modern comfort with stunning panoramic views over open countryside. Perfectly suited for family life, the layout includes a welcoming entrance hall, full-depth living room, spacious open-plan kitchen/dining room, home office, conservatory/utility, three bedrooms, and a family bathroom. Outside, the garage and under-garage basement provide exceptional storage, while the south-westerly garden captures the sun all afternoon through to spectacular sunsets.
Living Space
Step inside to a generous entrance hall with plenty of space for coats, shoes, and everyday essentials, keeping the rest of the home clutter-free.
On the upper ground floor, the full-length living room offers a rare sense of scale, with large windows at both ends filling the room with natural light. From the rear, the window perfectly frames those breathtaking countryside views. The space is styled with a contemporary finish, complemented by a traditional chimney breast, oak mantel, and decorative inlet for added charm.
Also on this level, a dedicated home office/study provides a quiet corner to work or focus, away from the busier heart of the home.
On the lower ground floor, the impressive open-plan kitchen and dining room is the social hub, complete with underfloor heating for year-round comfort. The kitchen’s timeless yet modern design features integrated appliances, including a double oven, microwave, fridge-freezer, dishwasher, and a four-ring hob with concealed extractor. The breakfast bar seats four, while the spacious dining area is perfect for family meals and entertaining guests. The room flows into the conservatory/utility, leading directly out to the garden for easy indoor-outdoor living.
Bedrooms & Bathroom
Upstairs, three well-proportioned bedrooms make the most of the home’s elevated position, with the rear bedrooms enjoying those same incredible scenic views. The family bathroom offers a blank canvas for a modern update to your own taste and style.
Outside Space
To the front, a private drive and garage provide easy parking, with the garage basement adding valuable extra storage.
The rear garden is a great highlight, south-westerly facing to catch the sun from midday until evening, with a raised decking area for relaxing, dining, and entertaining against the backdrop of breathtaking sunsets over Winter Hill. Below, the lawn offers space for children to play or for green-fingered owners to create their ideal garden retreat.
Location
Despite the peaceful, elevated setting, you’re just moments from the heart of Egerton village and only a short drive to Bromley Cross. Both offer an excellent choice of pubs, restaurants, shops, and highly regarded schools and nurseries.
For outdoor lovers, the surrounding countryside, reservoirs, and West Pennine Moors provide endless opportunities for walking, cycling, running, and sailing.
Commuters benefit from quick access to the A666 for motorway connections, while Bromley Cross Train Station — around five minutes’ drive — offers direct services into central Manchester.
Key Details
Tax band: C
Tenure: Leasehold
Ground rent: £14 per annum
Lease term: 1000 years from 1969
Heating: Gas boiler and radiators
Boiler: Worcester combi, installed in 2024
Loft: Insulated and boarded with a pull-down ladder installed

Nestled in a quiet cul-de-sac of Brambling Drive, Westhoughton, this stunning detached family home is a true gem not to be missed. Offering an impressive layout, the property boasts three spacious reception rooms, providing ample space for both relaxation and entertaining. The heart of the home features a delightful log burner fire, perfect for cosy evenings with family and friends.
With four well-appointed bedrooms, this residence caters to families of all sizes, ensuring everyone has their own personal space. The three modern bathrooms add to the convenience and comfort of this exceptional property, making morning routines a breeze.
The peaceful surroundings of Westhoughton enhance the appeal of this home, offering a serene environment while still being conveniently located near local amenities and transport links. This property is ideal for those seeking a harmonious blend of comfort and style in a family-friendly neighbourhood.
In summary, this remarkable home on Brambling Drive is perfect for those looking to settle in a quiet yet vibrant community. With its generous living spaces, modern conveniences, and charming features, it presents an excellent opportunity for family living. Do not hesitate to arrange a viewing and experience all that this wonderful property has to offer.

Entrance Hall

Lounge
 (5.14m x 3.59m)
This spacious lounge boasts a wood-effect herringbone floor and a feature fireplace with a rustic wooden beam mantle and a wood-burning stove, set against a deep blue accent wall. The room is filled with natural light from a large window, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere perfect for relaxing or entertaining.
Kitchen And Breakfast Area
The kitchen features modern dark gloss cabinetry with integrated appliances including an oven and microwave, complemented by a gas hob and stainless steel extractor. The tiled floor and splashbacks add a practical touch, while the large window above the sink floods the space with natural light. An adjoining breakfast area provides a cosy nook with space for casual dining, enhanced by patterned wallpaper and a comfortable armchair. The kitchen opens through an archway to the dining room, creating a smooth flow between the spaces.
Dining Room

It features a bathtub with a tiled surround, a separate walk-in shower with glass doors, a grey vanity unit with a marble-effect countertop, and a matching toilet. The floor is tiled in a complementary geometric pattern, and the room is brightened by a window with natural light.
Wc

 (3.80m x 4.57m)
Bedroom 1 is a large main bedroom with a soft grey carpet and a comfortable upholstered bed. It benefits from three windows allowing plenty of natural light and includes fitted wardrobes and a chest of drawers for ample storage. Bedroom 4

Bedroom 4 is another single room decorated in a soft pink tone with a grey carpet. It has a window to the outside and is furnished to suit a variety of uses, from a child’s bedroom to a guest room or hobby space.

The first floor landing is a bright space connecting the four bedrooms and bathrooms. It is carpeted in a soft grey and painted in neutral tones, creating a calm transition between rooms.
Rear Garden
The rear garden is a large, private space with a well-maintained lawn bordered by mature shrubs and trees, providing excellent privacy. A paved patio area offers a perfect spot for outdoor dining or relaxing, and a charming stepping stone path adds character while connecting different garden areas.
Front Exterior
The front exterior of the property features a double garage with mint green doors and a brick-paved driveway with ample parking space. A lawned area beside the driveway is neatly edged with mature hedging, providing a welcoming and private frontage.

Description
Offered for sale at an asking price of £475,000, this bespoke, extended semi-detached family home on sought-after Patch Croft Road in Peel Hall, Manchester presents a rare opportunity to acquire a truly immaculate property. Perfect for modern family living, the home provides a seamless blend of stylish contemporary finishes and versatile accommodation throughout, including a separate annex studio, landscaped garden, and off-road parking.
The main residence boasts a thoughtfully extended three bedroom layout, with generous living spaces arranged for comfort and practicality. Downstairs reveals two well-proportioned reception rooms that offer flexible use?ideal for entertaining, relaxation, or working from home. The heart of the home is the stunning open-plan kitchen, dining, and family room, expertly designed with high-quality fittings and striking bi-fold doors that feature integrated blinds, opening directly onto the landscaped rear garden. This airy and elegant space is flooded with natural light and perfectly suited for indoor-outdoor family life.
Upstairs, the property comprises three spacious bedrooms and two pristine bathrooms, along with a fully usable loft room that adds further versatility. One of the property's most enticing features is the self-contained annex studio to the rear, offering a private bedroom and modern shower room?ideal for guests or older children.
Externally, the beautifully landscaped rear garden offers a tranquil retreat with ample space for outdoor dining and family enjoyment. Planning permission has already been approved for further extension, offering exciting potential for future development. EPC rated C, the home ensures efficiency alongside elegance.
Patch Croft Road enjoys a prime location in Peel Hall, placing it within easy reach of a wide array of amenities. Local supermarkets including Tesco and Aldi are just a few minutes' drive, while several highly regarded primary and secondary schools are within walking distance. Residents also benefit from excellent leisure facilities nearby, including gyms, parks, and sports clubs. Wythenshawe Hospital is less than 10 minutes away, and the property boasts superb transport links, with easy access to Manchester Airport (approximately 4 miles away), as well as train connections via nearby Heald Green and Manchester Piccadilly stations.
Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the space, finish, and potential of this outstanding family home. Combining location, flexibility, and quality throughout, Patch Croft Road is a property not to be missed.

A stylishly presented and particularly spacious Victorian Semi-Detached family home

A stylishly presented and superbly proportioned victorian semi detached family home, located in this popular neighbourhood within walking distance of excellent schools, local shops, the metrolink and timperley and altrincham centres. 1735 sqft.
Hall. Lounge. Family Room. Dining Kitchen. Utility. WC. Four Double Bedrooms. Two Bath/Shower Rooms. Driveway. Garden. No Chain!
An attractive and particularly spacious Victorian Semi-Detached family home, in a quiet cul-de-sac and ideally located within a few minutes walk of the Metrolink at Park Road and walking distance to excellent schools, local shops as well as being close to both Timperley Village and Altrincham Town Centre.
The stylishly presented property is arranged over Three Floors with accommodation extending to some 1735 square feet providing a Hall, Lounge, Family Room, Dining Kitchen, Utility and WC to the Ground Floor and there are Four Double Bedrooms served by Two Bath/Shower Rooms over the Two Upper Floors.
Externally, there is a Driveway providing off street Parking and to the rear a good sized, low maintenance Garden with patio and Garden areas.
This property is offered for sale with no chain and could be moved into with the minimum of fuss.
Comprising:
Recessed Porch. Panelled door with stained and leaded glass feature.
Entrance Hall with spindle balustrade staircase rising to the First Floor. Doors provide access to the Ground Floor Living Accommodation. Stripped and stained floorboards. Dado rail surround. Coved ceiling. Decorative radiator cover.
Lounge with sash windows to the front and side elevations. Impressive cast iron fireplace feature to the chimney breast with tiled hearth. Picture rail surround. Coved ceiling.
Family Room with sash window to the rear elevation enjoying views over the gardens. Impressive cast iron fireplace feature with tiled insert and hearth. Built in cupboards and display shelving to either side of the chimney breast recess. Coved ceiling. Stripped and stained floorboards.
Dining Kitchen fitted with an extensive range of base and eye level units, incorporating a breakfast bar, with granite worktops over, inset into which is a stainless steel one and a half bowl sink and drainer unit with mixer tap over. Freestanding Range cooker. Integrated fridge, freezer and dishwasher. Two windows to the side elevation and French doors provide access to the same.
Utility Room with built in worktops and there is space and plumbing for a washing machine and tumble dryer. Wall mounted gas central heating boiler. Tiled floor. French doors overlook and provide access to the gardens to the rear.
Ground Floor WC fitted with a modern white suite and chrome fittings, providing a wash hand basin and WC. Panelled wall feature. Tiled floor. Opaque window to the side elevation. Built in storage cupboard with shelves.
To the First Floor Landing there is access to Three Double Bedrooms and a Family Bathroom. A staircase rises to the Second Floor Landing.
Principal Bedroom One is a superbly sized room with three windows to the front elevation. Bult in wardrobes provide excellent hanging and storage space.
Bedroom Two with reproduction sash window to the rear elevation enjoying views over the gardens. Built in wardrobes provide excellent hanging and storage space. Picture rail surround. Coved ceiling.
Bedroom Three with sash windows to the side and rear elevations enjoying views over the gardens to the rear. Built in wardrobes provide excellent hanging and storage space.
The Bedrooms are served by a Family Bathroom fitted with a modern white suite and chrome fittings, providing a freestanding double ended bath, separate enclosed shower cubicle with thermostatic shower, dual attachments and glazed door, wash hand basin and WC. Tiling to the walls and floor. Opaque sash window to the side elevation.
Second Floor Landing with inset Velux window and access to Bedroom Four. Dado rail surround.
Bedroom Four with attractive sloping ceilings with inset Velux window to the front and a window to the rear enjoying views over the gardens. Stripped and stained floorboards. Access to roof void storage.
This Bedrooms enjoys an En Suite Shower Room fitted with a modern white suite and chrome fittings, providing an enclosed shower cubicle with thermostatic shower and glazed sliding doors, wash hand basin and WC. Inset Velux window. Stripped and stained floorboards.
Externally, there is a paved Driveway providing off road parking and a stocked Garden frontage.
To the rear, there is a paved patio area adjacent to the back of the house, accessed via the doors from the Dining Kitchen and Utility Room. Beyond, the Garden is laid to astroturf with additional paved patio area with well stocked borders with a variety of plants, shrubs and trees.
This property is offered for sale with no chain and could be moved into with the minimum of fuss.

Exceptional Four-Bedroom Extended Detached Home in Prime Whitefield Location
Perfectly positioned on the highly sought-after Fairhaven Avenue, this beautifully presented four-bedroom detached property offers generous living space, a versatile layout, and a prime location — making it an outstanding choice for modern family life.
The ground floor is designed with both practicality and style in mind. At the front, a spacious lounge provides a welcoming retreat, while to the rear, a stunning second lounge with floor-to-ceiling windows enjoys views over the garden and floods the space with natural light. The heart of the home is the sleek, modern open-plan kitchen and dining area with integrated neff appliances and underfloor heating — perfect for everyday family living and entertaining.
There’s no shortage of flexible space, with a second office room, a separate versatile room currently used as a home gym, and a large built-in storage cupboard. A practical utility room and a convenient downstairs WC complete the ground floor layout.
Upstairs, there are four well-proportioned bedrooms, including a stylish master suite with its own en-suite. The remaining bedrooms are served by a contemporary family bathroom.
Outside, the property offers ample off-road parking and a landscaped rear garden designed for year-round enjoyment, featuring a low-maintenance AstroTurf lawn and a generous patio — perfect for dining and relaxing outdoors.
With its combination of space, versatility, and a sought-after address in Whitefield, this home is ready for you to move straight in and enjoy. Early viewing is strongly recommended to fully appreciate all that it has to offer.

title: 3 bed semi-detached bungalow for sale Elvington Crescent, Worsley, Manchester M28
about_property:
Extended 3/4 Bedroom Semi-Detached Dormer Bungalow
Quiet Horseshoe Cul-De-Sac On Sought-After Crescent
Stunning South-Facing Garden – Exceptionally Large, Private & Backs Onto Peaceful Woodland
Modern Kitchen & Utility Room + Ground Floor Shower Room
Versatile Living Spaces – Conservatory With Garden Views, Plus A Lounge Or Optional Fourth Bedroom
Ample Off-Road Parking – Large Driveway & Detached Garage/Workshop
Move-In Ready – New Boiler (2024) And Full Rewire (2018)
Fantastic Local Amenities & Transport
Superb Extended Three/Four Bedroom Dormer Bungalow in a Sought-After Cul-De-Sac Location. Rarely do properties become available on the highly desirable Elvington Crescent, and this extended semi-detached dormer bungalow offers an exceptional opportunity for those seeking space, flexibility, and a truly outstanding garden.
Set on a quiet horseshoe cul-de-sac with a peaceful green area to the front and minimal traffic, the home boasts ample off-road parking, gated side access, and a detached garage/workshop—ideal for families, hobbyists, or anyone needing extra space.
Inside, the home is in move-in condition, beginning with a welcoming entrance porch and ground floor shower room. A versatile front-facing room serves perfectly as a private lounge or fourth bedroom. The heart of the home is a generously sized lounge/dining area, seamlessly flowing into a light-filled conservatory with stunning garden views. The modern shaker-style kitchen features a breakfast bar, built-in electric oven/grill, hob, cooker hood and dishwasher, plus space for a fridge/freezer. A separate utility room with additional units, sink, space for a washing machine and French doors to the garden provides excellent convenience. The ground floor also hosts a spacious bedroom with dual-aspect windows. Upstairs, you’ll find two further double bedrooms, both double aspect, and a contemporary fully tiled bathroom with bath and shower.
What truly sets this home apart is the extensive, south-facing rear garden—an unexpected gem. Tranquil and secluded, it features a huge lawn, patios, mature trees and shrubs, a large greenhouse, vegetable and strawberry patches, and even apple, pear, and cherry trees—all backing onto peaceful woodland. Your very own garden paradise!
Additional upgrades include a new boiler (2024) and a full rewire (2018), plus a fully functioning fitted alarm system ensuring modern efficiency and peace of mind.
You’re ideally placed for excellent local schools, including James Brindley Community Primary School and Ellenbrook Community Primary School, both well-regarded and just a short distance away. Commuting is a breeze thanks to the nearby A580 East Lancs Road, M60 motorway, and the Guided Busway, offering fast and reliable access into Manchester and beyond. Walkden train station is also close by, ideal for daily commuters. For daily needs Walkden Town Centre is just a short trip away, offering supermarkets, shops, restaurants, and more. When it’s time to relax, enjoy nearby green spaces like Parr Fold Park—great for family outings—or take a stroll or bike ride along the Roe Green Loopline, a beautiful traffic-free route leading to Monton and Worsley Village, both brimming with charm, cafes, and Canalside walks. You’ll also find local favourites like The Woodside pub, perfect for a weekend meal or drink, all within easy reach. This location truly offers the best of both worlds—peaceful suburban living with convenience, connectivity, and community all wrapped into one.
This exceptional property combines flexible living, generous outdoor space, and a highly desirable location—early viewing is strongly advised.
Additional Information

Pristine four-bedroom detached family home on the coveted Bodmin Road in Astley. This family residence features spacious living areas, including a sitting room, open-plan kitchen diner, conservatory, and study on the ground floor. The first floor includes four generously sized bedrooms. The exterior of the property is set on a large plot with a stunning front garden, a detached double garage, and a well-maintained rear garden. Conveniently located on Bodmin Road, the property is close to excellent schools, shops, amenities, and the popular guided busway.
The property features an entrance porch that leads to a welcoming hallway with stairs to the upper floor and doors to the living areas. There is a spacious sitting room with a front-facing window and double doors opening to the dining area. The open-plan family area includes a dining space that transitions into the kitchen and conservatory. The modern kitchen is equipped with stylish wall and base units, integrated appliances such as a fridge, freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, and cooking facilities, along with elegant countertops and a breakfast bar. Additionally, it has an external door to the side of the property and a rear-facing window. The conservatory, accessible through the kitchen and dining area, offers panoramic views of the rear garden and features a solid roof for year-round enjoyment. From the hallway, there is access to a convenient downstairs W.C. And a separate study room with a front-facing window.
Ascending to the first floor, you'll find the master bedroom at the property's front, featuring a front-facing window and an ensuite shower room with a WC, sink, and walk-in shower. The second large double bedroom is also at the front with a front-facing window. At the back, the third double-sized bedroom offers fully fitted wardrobes and a rear-facing window. The fourth and final bedroom is also at the back with a rear-facing window. Completing the upstairs area are a storage cupboard and the family bathroom, which includes a bathtub with Jacuzzi jets and an overhead shower, WC, sink, wall tiling, and a rear-facing window.
Externally, the property unfolds through elegant double gates, granting a shared entryway with the neighboring property. This splendid space boasts generous driveway parking and leads into the double garage, equipped with up and over doors for effortless access. The front lawn, meticulously tended, is adorned with decorative shrubs that provide privacy, creating a welcoming addition to gardens. At the rear, the property invites you to the patio area through the conservatory's double doors, while an equally pristine lawn, embellished with charming shrubs and borders, gracefully extends around the side of the house,
with a gate leading through to the front lawn.
This freehold property is of traditional construction, is connected to all mains services, offers UPVC double glazing throughout, and is warmed by gas central heating, . The property also offers loft access.

The second bedroom is also a spacious double, whilst the third bedroom presents a comfortable single room, ideal as a nursery, study, or guest room.
The family bathroom is finished to a high standard, equipped with a modern white suite, a relaxing bath with separate shower, and a heated towel rail, ensuring a touch of luxury to your daily routine. Externally, the private low maintenance garden offers an inviting outdoor retreat, perfect for children to play or alfresco dining during warmer months.
Immaculately presented and in good condition throughout, this home provides both comfort and practicality in a peaceful cul de sac setting. It is an excellent opportunity for those seeking a move-in ready property close to local amenities and well-regarded schools. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate all this superb family home has to offer.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction allowing the buyer and seller to complete within a 56 Day Reservation Period. Interested parties’ personal data will be shared with the Auctioneer (iamsold Ltd).

This three-bedroom semi-detached house is offered to the market with no onward chain, making it an ideal choice for buyers looking for a straightforward move.

Stepping inside, the entrance hall leads directly into a bright and modern kitchen, updated just two years ago. Upstairs, you will find three bedrooms. The master bedroom features fitted wardrobes, helping to maximise storage while keeping the space tidy. The family bathroom is well presented and includes a vanity sink unit, providing additional storage and a clean, modern finish.

To the rear, the garden has been designed for low maintenance with an artificial lawn and a patio area, ideal for outdoor seating and dining in the warmer months. The single garage, currently used as a workshop, offers further storage or work space, adding to the property’s practicality.

Offered with no onward chain, a beautifully presented and deceptively spacious modern end-townhouse, perfectly positioned on a sought-after development in Bottom Mossley with picturesque views over the River Tame and offered with No Upward Chain.
Built circa 2007, this stylish home offers versatile accommodation over three floors, making it an ideal choice for growing families or those seeking flexible living space. The property’s location is superb, with local amenities, well-regarded schools, and Mossley train station all within easy reach, providing excellent commuter links to Manchester and West Yorkshire.
The welcoming entrance hall features a useful storage cupboard and provides access to a versatile ground-floor bedroom/office, ideal for guests or home working. Also on this level is a modern three-piece shower room, a utility room with direct access to the rear garden, and an integral garage for additional storage or secure parking.
To the first floor, the well-appointed fitted kitchen/diner offers a range of matching units, ample worktop space, and room for family dining. The spacious, ‘l’-shaped lounge enjoys a bright dual aspect, creating a comfortable setting for both relaxing and entertaining.
The second floor hosts two generous double bedrooms, each benefiting from its own en-suite shower room, adding convenience and privacy for occupants.
Warmed by a gas central heating system with combination boiler and enhanced by uPVC double glazing, the home ensures year-round comfort and efficiency.
Externally, the property features a driveway for two vehicles leading to the garage at the front, while to the rear there is a mature enclosed garden with lawn and decked areas – perfect for outdoor dining, play, or relaxation.
With its desirable riverside position, modern layout, and easy access to nearby towns such as Uppermill, Stalybridge, and Ashton, this property is a must-see for buyers seeking a well-connected home in a charming setting.

title: 3 bed bungalow for sale Whitley Crescent, Wigan WN1
about_property:
Immaculate Detached True Bungalow
Sought After Whitley Crescent Location
Large Impressive Gardens
Light, Bright Spacious Rooms
Large Driveway and Garage
New Kitchen and Bathrooms
Set in the heart of Whitley, one of Wigan’s most desirable and prestigious locations, this exceptional true bungalow presents a rare opportunity to acquire a beautifully renovated home in a setting of leafy lanes, with Haigh Country Estate, Mesnes Park, and highly sought-after schools all just moments away.
Occupying a generous and meticulously maintained corner plot, this stunning home has been transformed by the current owners into a tranquil haven of style, warmth, and practicality. Covering an impressive 1,268 sq ft, the individually designed layout is both welcoming and functional, with every detail thoughtfully considered.
Step inside via a spacious entrance hallway, complete with a cloakroom and coats store—a practical and inviting first impression. The impressive lounge is flooded with natural light thanks to a large picture window, and features a beautiful stone fireplace creating an elegant focal point for the room.
The refitted kitchen is sleek and modern, offering integrated appliances including eye-level ovens, an electric hob, fridge/freezer, and dishwasher. The kitchen leads to a formal dining room—ideal for entertaining or family gatherings—and to bedroom three, currently used as a cosy snug. Both of these rooms feature French doors that open out onto the stunning rear garden patio.
All of the bedrooms are of generous proportions, with bedroom three/snug offering versatility depending on your lifestyle needs. The contemporary bathroom is a real showstopper, boasting a freestanding pebble-shaped bath, separate walk-in shower, vanity unit, and striking wall tiling that completes the luxury feel.
With outdoor living at Its finest, the exterior of the home is equally impressive. Resting on a substantial corner plot, the property boasts manicured gardens to the front and rear. A large flagged driveway provides ample parking for multiple vehicles and leads to an attached garage.
To the rear, the private garden is a gardener’s dream—secure, peaceful, and beautifully landscaped with lawns, elegant planting, a raised ornamental pond, and extensive patio space perfect for al fresco dining. Additional highlights include a covered seating area ideal for relaxing on cooler evenings and a charming pergola to enjoy throughout the seasons.
Properties of this calibre in Whitley are exceptionally rare—especially those offering such a large plot, impeccable condition, and a truly enviable location. Situated on the delightful Whitley Crescent, this ready-to-move-into home must be viewed internally to be fully appreciated.

This spacious South-West facing 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom corner apartment is set within the popular Spectrum development on Blackfriars Road, just minutes from Deansgate and Spinningfields in central Manchester.

Sliding doors lead out to a private wrap-around balcony, perfect for relaxing or entertaining, with views over the city skyline.
Both double bedrooms are well-proportioned, with the master featuring built-in wardrobes and a stylish en-suite. A high-spec main bathroom serves the second bedroom, and both are finished to an excellent standard with quality fixtures.

title: 5 bed property for sale St. Barnabas Drive, Littleborough OL15
about_property:
Five bedrooms
Edwardian residence
An elite style of presentation
Four receptions
Meticulous gardens
Gated sweeping driveway
Exquisite kitchen
Laundry and Utility
Three bathrooms
Exceptional and large gardens
A beautifully imposing Edwardian detached residence, magnificently set within its own grounds, and quite possibly being one of the finest homes within the area.
The Old Vicarage is nicely nestled at the end of St Barnabas Drive with meticulously prepared gardens, gated sweeping driveway and a 'tip of the hat' to some amazing views of the local and surrounding countryside.
This is undoubtedly a gorgeous family home, where perhaps anyone who has business in Manchester or indeed Leeds, can easily 'return home' to a place that sits within the countryside and yet boasts a positioning that enjoys a convenient connection to the highly desirable centre of Littleborough Village where boutique clothes and coffee shops await. The countryside is also quite literally on the doorstep making a quick escape into the hills very easy indeed, and if commuting is your thing, the train links from here are superb.
This enigmatic dwelling has a style and an elite quality that seems to lavishly exude from everywhere and it is clearly evident that every detail from 'décor' to 'flow' has been immensely and professionally considered.
A brief insight into this exceptional and individual home further includes:
Ground floor – As you enter the property the large vestibule with original doors and ornate windows instantly welcomes you. There is a traditional cloaks room to the side. The reception hall has a returning stair case with a spindled balustrade to the first floor gallery style landing. The receptions are perfectly designed and decorated to enhance a function for each room as each one echoes its own personality. The study is already set for business as you will see. The sitting room is somewhere to put your feet up, and enjoy the roaring fire. The day lounge is again a place where the family may gather to catch up after the evening meal, still enjoying the sumptuous theme and with perhaps a more modern flair. From this lounge is access into the sun room with bi-folding doors, which is perfect if you are entertaining or is just the best place for an early morning coffee. The breakfast kitchen which is accessed from the hall and the sun room, is beautifully fitted with a breath taking selection of wall and base units, in-built appliances and matching Corian work surfaces. From here is access into the Utility and Laundry Room and personal access into the large double garage. Within here is a separate gym and a separate w.c.
First floor – the spacious and light galleried landing leads very nicely into each of the five double bedrooms and the two family bathrooms. As with the ground floor every detail has certainly been brushed with a professional eye. The Master Bedroom has been tastefully fitted with an exceptional level of quality furniture with a window seat to the bay. Bedroom number two enjoys its own en-suite bathroom and the house bathroom comprises of a luxury four piece suite. The guest bathroom is slightly smaller and still enjoys a sumptuous three piece suite.
Externally – at the front is the gravelled sweeping driveway with electronic security gated entrance. The gardens are meticulous and range from the traditional lawn with mature shrubbery borders, to a Zen style area. There is composite decking just from the garden room that currently leads to the large hot tub.
Please note the property has solar panels and our client informs that there is a saving of approximately £2,500 per year.
EPC Rating: D

Cardwells estate agents are delighted to bring to market this immaculately presented four bedroom semi detached home. Occupying a superb corner freehold plot in a quiet cul de position this lovely home comprises; entrance hallway, downstairs cloak/WC, lounge, dining room, newly fitted dining kitchen, four bedrooms and a family bathroom. Externally this property boasts a driveway for numerous cars leading to a garage with double doors and beautiful mature gardens to the front and rear. Situated in a conveniently sought after residential area, close to local schools, amenities and just a short drive to Bury town centre this property would suit a growing family! about_property:

A beautiful three Bedroom Semi-Detached Home on a Generous Plot – Seddons Farm, Bury
Nestled in the heart of the highly sought-after Seddons Farm estate in Bury, this well-presented three-bedroom semi-detached home offers spacious and versatile living throughout. Perfect for families, the property sits on a generous plot with well-maintained front and rear gardens, a private driveway, and a detached garage.
Inside, you’ll find a large, modern kitchen/diner, ideal for entertaining or relaxed family meals, alongside a bright and comfortable living area and a well-maintained bathroom. All three bedrooms are generously sized, offering flexibility for growing families or home working.
Located within close proximity to reputable local schools, shops, and excellent transport links, this home combines comfort, space, and convenience in a highly desirable location.
Don't miss your chance to secure a superb family home in one of Bury’s most popular residential areas. Early viewing is highly recommended!

display_address: Croft End Place, Ramsbottom, Bury BL0
title: 4 bed detached house for sale Croft End Place, Ramsbottom, Bury BL0
address: Croft End Place, Ramsbottom, Bury BL0
about_property:
Modern detached house
Superbly presented
Sought development
Four bedrooms
Large family kitchen
Generous gardens, parking & garage
Croft End Place, Ramsbottom is a beautifully presented, modern, four bedroom detached house set at the entrance to this recently built cul-de-sac of homes from Eccleston Homes. The house has a stylish and contemporary interior ideally suited to the modern family and with potential wfh options, set in generously sized, walled gardens with spacious landscaped patio and lawns. The house has the usual benefits of gas fired central heating sand is PVC double glazed. The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with stairs to the first floor and guests wc/cloaks, living room, dining room, spacious family kitchen, utility room, first floor, four bedrooms main with an ensuite shower room and additional family bathroom. Outside there is a garden forecourt, and long side driveway leading to a detached garage with remotely operated door and to the rear generously sized gardens with stylish large patio and lawn.
Council Tax Band E/Freehold Property there is a management company as the address is a private road costing £28pm.
Hallway
 (4.29 x 1.96 m)
This welcoming hallway features neutral décor complemented by wood-effect flooring and a carpeted staircase leading to the first floor. The space is bright and airy, with clean lines and modern touches, offering access to other rooms on the ground floor.
Wc
 (1.03 x 1.66 m)
The downstairs cloakroom is thoughtfully designed with white sanitary ware including a wall-mounted sink and a close-coupled toilet. A window allows natural light to brighten the space, which is finished with light-coloured flooring and pale walls for a fresh feel.
Living Room
 (5.86 x 3.63 m)
The living room is a comfortable and inviting space, carpeted throughout and decorated in soft neutral tones. It boasts a stylish, contemporary wall-mounted fireplace below a large flat-screen TV, flanked by bespoke grey cabinetry. A bay window with white shutters fills the room with natural light, enhancing the cosy, relaxed atmosphere.
Dining Room
 (3.04 x 2.73 m)
This elegant dining room features a round dining table surrounded by upholstered chairs. The room is softly carpeted with a large window dressed with neutral curtains and blinds, allowing plenty of natural light to fill the space. It offers a quiet and intimate space for meals and gatherings.
Family Kitchen
 (5.60 x 5.73 m)
The family kitchen is a bright, spacious area with a modern design and an open plan layout extending into a casual dining space. It features a central island with seating for three, sleek cabinetry in soft tones, and integrated appliances including an oven and extractor above the hob, fridge, freezer and dishwasher. Large windows and bi-fold doors open to the garden, flooding the space with natural light and providing a pleasant view of the outdoors. Wood-effect flooring adds warmth and practicality.
Utility Room
 (2.92 x 1.86 m)
The utility room is a practical space fitted with base cabinets and boiler cupboard, a work surface, and plumbing for washing and drying appliances. A door offers convenient garden access, while a window brings in daylight, making it an efficient and useful addition to the home.
Landing
 (0.97 x 3.00 m)
The first-floor landing is bright and airy, featuring white woodwork and balustrades with a striking dark grey feature wall. This space provides access to all bedrooms and bathrooms on the first floor.
Bedroom 1
 (4.16 x 2.75 m)
The master bedroom is spacious and carpeted, decorated in soft green tones with large windows dressed in neutral curtains. It benefits from an ensuite shower room and offers plenty of space for bedroom furniture, creating a calm and restful retreat.
Ensuite
 (1.47 x 1.98 m)
The ensuite shower room adjacent to the master bedroom features a tiled floor with a white suite including a shower cubicle, toilet, and basin with a heated towel rail. The room is finished in light neutral tones with a window providing ventilation and natural light.
Bedroom 2
 (4.67 x 3.70 m)
Bedroom 2 is a well-proportioned, carpeted room with a large window dressed with grey curtains. The light walls and simple furnishings create a comfortable space suitable for a double bed and additional furniture.
Bedroom 3
 (2.98 x 2.75 m)
Bedroom 3 offers a cosy space with neutral décor and carpeting. A window provides natural light, and there is enough room for a double bed and furniture, making it a versatile room for family or guests.
Bedroom 4
 (2.93 x 2.61 m)
This bedroom is carpeted and decorated in soft grey tones, with a window dressed in light curtains. It offers a peaceful sleeping space with enough room for a double bed and storage.
Bathroom
 (1.73 x 2.14 m)
The family bathroom is finished with tiled flooring and part-tiled walls. It includes a white suite comprising a bath, wall-mounted basin, and toilet. The neutral décor and window add to the light and airy feel of this room.
Rear Garden
The rear garden is a private, enclosed space featuring a mix of lawn and paved patio areas. Surrounded by a stone wall and wooden fencing with mature shrubs and plants, it provides a peaceful outdoor setting. There is a seating area with garden furniture and umbrella, perfect for relaxing or entertaining in the sunshine.
Garage
 (6.01 x 3.21 m)
This detached garage offers a secure space for vehicle parking or storage. It measures just over 6 metres in length and 3 metres in width, providing useful additional space to the property.

display_address: Local Crescent, Hulme Street, Salford M5
title: 1 bed flat for sale Local Crescent, Hulme Street, Salford M5
address: Local Crescent, Hulme Street, Salford M5
about_property:
Prime Salford location
No chain & Sold With Sitting Tenants
Bright open-plan living area
Modern kitchen
Spacious bedroom with built-in storage
Contemporary bathroom
Private balcony with impressive views over Manchester and Salford
Luxury on-site facilities
No Chain – Modern Apartment with Balcony Views of Manchester & Salford
Situated in the heart of Salford’s vibrant and rejuvenated Crescent area, this stylish one-bedroom apartment offers modern city living with superb on-site amenities and stunning views. Just a ten-minute walk from Manchester City Centre, and within easy reach of Salford University, Salford Central Train Station, and MediaCityUK, it’s ideal for professionals, students, or investors seeking a prime location.
Step into a bright, modern kitchen fitted with white cupboards, ample storage, an integrated washer, dishwasher, electric oven, electric hob, and cooker hood, plus space for a freestanding fridge-freezer. The kitchen flows seamlessly into the main living space, decorated with cream carpets, where patio doors flood the room with natural light and open onto a private balcony overlooking the surrounding cityscape.
The spacious bedroom benefits from built-in storage and offers “Jack and Jill” access to the bathroom, which is decorated floor-to-ceiling in white tiles for easy maintenance and features a step-in bath with overhead shower.
Local Crescent is a modern purpose-built development by prestigious developers Salboy, designed with a high-end finish, thoughtful layouts, and premium fixtures. Residents enjoy an exceptional range of facilities including a heated swimming pool, cinema room, gymnasium, solarium, sauna and spa, laundry area, landscaped courtyard garden, and a rooftop terrace with panoramic views.
With no onward chain, excellent transport links, and an unbeatable location, this apartment combines convenience, style, and comfort in one of Salford’s most sought-after neighbourhoods
Additional Information

• Length of lease – 250 years from and including 5 October 2020

Facilities management / routine maintenance/ non specific repairs / gym / pool / cinema / utilities / connectivity / sinking / professional fees**

title: 4 bed detached house for sale Blakefield Drive, Worsley, Manchester M28
about_property:
Freehold four-bedroom home
Fully owned solar panel system
Driveway parking for up to three cars
Bright and spacious open-plan living room
Modern kitchen-diner
Master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room
Large family bathroom
Prime location
Spacious Four-Bedroom Freehold Home with Driveway, Solar Panels & Prime Worsley Location
Tucked away in a peaceful cul-de-sac in Worsley, this beautifully presented four-bedroom freehold home offers modern living, excellent energy efficiency, and superb transport links. With solar panels, a driveway for up to three cars, and generous living spaces throughout, this is a property that perfectly balances comfort and practicality.
Step inside to a bright and spacious hallway, complete with storage space under the stairs and light grey flooring that flows seamlessly through the ground floor. The neatly positioned downstairs WC features striking floor-to-ceiling blue tiling for a splash of colour and easy maintenance.
The main living room is impressively large, with a bay window at the front and patio doors at the rear flooding the space with natural light. A dining area sits at the back, creating a perfect setting for family meals and entertaining. The contemporary kitchen-diner boasts grey high-gloss cupboards, white marble-effect countertops, and integrated appliances including an electric oven, grill, hob, and cooker hood as well as a dishwasher. There’s also space for a washer/dryer and freestanding fridge freezer, along with excellent storage. To the rear, an additional seating area with patio and large windows offers a lovely garden outlook and could easily serve as a second dining space.
Upstairs, the master bedroom is bright and generously sized, with fitted wardrobes spanning one wall. Its en-suite bathroom combines blue and white tiling with a walk-in shower. Two further double bedrooms provide plenty of space for family or guests, while the fourth bedroom works perfectly as a home office or dressing room. The large family bathroom features both a bath and a separate shower, with floor-to-ceiling stone-coloured tiling for a sleek, low-maintenance finish. An internal storage area offers the perfect hideaway for laundry.
The rear garden is a secure, private space with both paved and lawned areas, enclosed by fencing.
One of the property’s standout features is its fully owned solar panel system, which significantly reduces electricity bills and improves overall energy efficiency. Not only does this provide immediate savings, but it also offers long-term financial and environmental benefits, making this home both cost-effective and eco-friendly.
Perfectly situated just moments from Parr Fold Park and the scenic Roe Green Loopline, this home is within walking distance of Mesne Lea Primary School, Co-op Academy Walkden, and local shops. Excellent road and rail links via the A580, M60, and Walkden Station ensure fast access to Manchester city centre, Salford Quays, and Bolton. The rhs Bridgewater Gardens, charming pubs, cafés, and further amenities are also just minutes away.
This is a rare opportunity to secure a spacious, energy-efficient home in a highly desirable location – early viewing is strongly recommended.

A fantastic 3 bedroom semi-detached property located in a small cul-de-sac leading directly to the canal, with Ancoats & New Islington just around a 10 minute stroll. Beautifully presented throughout with a stunning landscaped rear garden and driveway parking for 2 cars, this impressive contemporary home is ready to move straight in with no onward chain! EPC Rating B.

Summary
With a highly desirable M4 postcode, this modern 3 bedroom semi-detached property is set in a pleasant cul-de-sac away from passing traffic, leading directly to the Rochdale canal towpath providing a direct walking route to Ancoats, New Islington and the wider city centre. The property has been maintained to an immaculate standard and has the benefit of various upgrades to include air conditioning, luxury shower room and a stunning landscaped rear garden. Properties of this style in such a desirable setting are rarely available, and we highly recommend a viewing to fully appreciate all that it has to offer!
Ground Floor
Entrance Hall
A welcoming reception area with attractive wooden-style flooring, radiator, carpeted staircase to the first floor with storage cupboard below.
Living Room
 (5.04m x 2.89m (16' 6" x 9' 6"))
French doors leading out to the garden and a further window providing additional natural light. Flooring matches the hall to create a seamless flow between the spaces. Air-conditioning unit and radiator.
Kitchen/Diner
 (4.55m x 2.78m (14' 11" x 9' 1"))
With ample space for a dining table, window to front elevation, tiled flooring, radiator. Range of fitted gloss base and wall units with contrasting worksurfaces, sink with mixer tap, subway-style tiled splashbacks, LED worktop lighting and recessed spotlights. Range of integral appliances to include electric oven, electric hob with stainless steel splashback, microwave, dishwasher and washing machine.
Downstairs WC
With obscure window to the side elevation, wash basin with mixer tap, tiled splashbacks and flooring, heated towel rail.
First Floor
Carpeted landing with air-conditioning unit and cupboard over the stairs.
Bedroom 1
 (3.9m x 2.34m (12' 10" x 7' 8"))
Window to the front elevation, carpeted floor, radiator and fitted wardrobe.
Bedroom 2
 (3.9m x 2.75m (12' 10" x 9' 0"))

Bedroom 3

Window to the rear elevation, carpeted floor, radiator.
Shower Room
 (2.16m x 1.96m (7' 1" x 6' 5"))
Obscure window to the front elevation. Upgraded to provide a large walk-in shower, wash basin with mixer tap, WC, tiled splashbacks and flooring, heated towel rail.
External
Garden to the front with pedestrian gate. Driveway parking to the side with further gated parking for a total of 2 vehicles and 2 EV chargers. The rear garden benefits from a sunny south-westerly elevation and has been beautifully landscaped to offer a large paved patio immediately to the rear of the house, with artificial lawn beyond ensuring the garden looks great all year round and minimising maintenance. A further patio area with pergola at the rear boundary provides a further pleasant seating area. Fully enclosed by timber fencing offering a high level of privacy and security with well-stocked borders along the perimeter.

An extended and beautifully presented three-bedroom semi-detached home in a sought-after area of Chadderton, offering open-plan living, a spacious garden, off-street parking, and excellent transport links. EPC - D
Ryder & Dutton are delighted to present this extended three-bedroom semi-detached home, beautifully presented throughout and located in one of Chadderton’s most sought-after areas — a superb opportunity for family buyers.
On the ground floor, you are welcomed by an inviting entrance hallway leading into an open-plan layout combining the sitting room, living room, and dining area, creating a bright and versatile space. The large, well-equipped kitchen completes the ground floor accommodation.
Upstairs, there are three bedrooms (two doubles and one generous single) along with a modern family bathroom featuring a stylish four-piece suite.
Externally, the property benefits from a block-paved driveway to the front, providing off-street parking, and a detached garage to the rear which can be used for additional parking or storage. The rear garden is private and spacious, offering both lawned and patio areas — perfect for relaxing, entertaining guests, or providing space for children to play.
Situated in a highly desirable part of Chadderton, the home is within walking distance of several well-regarded schools, Chadderton Hall Park, shops, and supermarkets. Excellent transport links are close by — Mills Hill Railway Station is just a 15-minute walk, offering direct access to Manchester City Centre, and the motorway network is right on the doorstep.
Internal inspection is highly recommended to fully appreciate all this property has to offer.

display_address: Delph Lodge, Huddersfield Road, Delph, Saddleworth OL3
title: 3 bed terraced house for sale Delph Lodge, Huddersfield Road, Delph, Saddleworth OL3
address: Delph Lodge, Huddersfield Road, Delph, Saddleworth OL3
about_property:
Delph
Substantial terraced cottage
Approx 1,450 square feet
Two receptions & three bedrooms
Mature garden with fruit trees, bushes & herbs
Off-road parking for three vehicles
Close to local amenities
Freehold
Council tax band 'E'
EPC: Tbc
A deceptively spacious mid-terraced cottage set in an enviable position just a short walk to the sought-after village of Delph. An ideal family home, viewing comes highly recommended. EPC: Tbc.
Set behind beautifully tended and substantial gardens, this charming home offers almost 1,500 square feet of accommodation, making it an ideal choice for family purchasers looking for additional space both internally and externally.
Easily accessible from both the front & rear, where there is ample off road parking, personal viewing of the ground floor will reveal an entrance hall which opens into a multi-use room, previously used as a home office. A farmhouse style kitchen features a composite sink, range cooker and ample worktop space, and the large dining room features double doors leading out the well-stocked and mature garden.
The large and welcoming lounge features mullion windows, exposed stone & brick fireplace and 'parquet' style wooden flooring, all helping to blend tradition into modern living.
To the first floor viewers will find three bedrooms, all of which are good-sized double rooms, and a family bathroom comprising of a hand-wash basin and panelled bath with shower over. The WC is adjacent to bathroom, and a useful storage room containing the boiler and plumbed for a washing machine completes the accommodation.
Benefitting from Smart heating controls, the property is warmed by an 'Ideal Logic+' combination boiler and well-maintained hardwood double glazed windows enhance the economy and comfort further.
Externally to the rear there is off-road parking for up to three vehicles, two storage sheds and steps to an upper seating area with further shed and wood store. No public access across the property makes it private and pleasant enhancement.
To the front, the mature and substantial enclosed garden benefits from both lawn and patio areas, including a multitude of shrubs and plants ensuring almost year-round colour. A growers paradise, the vegetable garden features a variety of plants, herbs and fruit trees, including gooseberry & blueberry bushes, apple & pear trees, rhubarb, strawberries and lemon balm. The owners have also been able to grow a wide variety of herbs and vegetables in the raised beds, including brassicas, pulses, garlic, onions and potatoes, whilst using a greenhouse to produce tomatoes, coriander and other herbs.
Delph Lodge can be located just off Huddersfield Road on the fringes of the popular village of Delph in Saddleworth. With trendy pubs, cafés and wine bars within walking distance, the property is also ideal for easy access to neighbouring villages including Dobcross, Diggle and Uppermill and as such, this would prove an ideal choice.

display_address: Ashworth Hall Cottage, Ashworth Road, Norden - Outstanding Character Property, Almost 3, 000Sqft & Beautiful Surroundings OL11
title: 4 bed property for sale Ashworth Hall Cottage, Ashworth Road, Norden - Outstanding Character Property, Almost 3, 000Sqft & Beautiful Surroundings OL11
address: Ashworth Hall Cottage, Ashworth Road, Norden - Outstanding Character Property, Almost 3, 000Sqft & Beautiful Surroundings OL11
about_property:
Ashworth Hall Cottage, Ashworth Road, Norden
4 Bed, 3 Bath, 3 Receps, Wine Cellar & Cinema Room
An Outstanding, Period Character Property, Set Over 4 Floors
Generous Living Space Of Almost 3,000sqft
Beautifully Presented Inside & Out
Superb Retained Character Features
Excellent Patio, Pond, Lawn, Gardens & Wooded Outlook
Electric-Gated Private Parking & Detached Timber Garage
Viewing essential - Available Now By Appointment Only
Contact Our Rawtenstall Office Exclusively To View
This stunning, period character property is believed to date to the 17th/18th Century and forms part of the original 'Ashworth Hall'. Now one of 3 cottages and offering exceptionally generous, 4 bedroom living over 4 floors, this superb home has gorgeous outside space too. 3 Bathrooms and 3 receptions provide versatile accommodation, while electric-gated parking, a patio, pond, gardens and lawn add superb outdoor areas and complete the picture here. This beautiful Grade II Listed property sits within a quite wonderful setting amongst country surroundings yet is within just minutes of Bury town centre. It has a great range of nearby local amenities and is without doubt, a genuinely outstanding opportunity.
Ashworth Hall Cottage, Ashworth Road, Norden is one of those unusual properties which can truly be called exquisite. With deceptively spacious accommodation, well arranged over 4 storeys and amounting to almost 3,000sqft in all, this 4 bedroom / 3 bathroom / 3 receptions Grade II Listed home is an outstanding period property, boasting an absolute wealth of beautiful aspects and character features.
From stone flagged floors to impressive beamed ceilings and from the Feature Fireplace to the superb Kitchen and Bathrooms, this property has it all - even a Cinema Room and Wine Cellar too! Moving outside things are no less impressive with private electric-gated access to the ample parking and detached timber garage. There is a superb stone paved rear patio overlooking the beautiful mature Koi pond and wooded outlooks beyond, while the spacious garden area has a superb lawn, hedging and stone walls too. There is certainly ample space here for a kitchen garden or perhaps a garden building for a work from home option STP if desired. Additionally, to the front, the property can also be approached through a listed, historic gateway which gives shared access to this and the adjoining properties and is the original entrance to Ashworth Hall.
In all, this glorious home enjoys a great setting in a fabulous location amongst lovely surroundings and offers everything needed for modern family living within a property of excellent period features. Viewings here are available now, exclusively by appointment through our Rawtenstall office - contact us now to arrange you private viewing appointment.
Internally, this property is arranged over 4 storeys in all and briefly comprises:
Ground floor - Entrance Vestibule, Hallway with Downstairs WC, Lounge, Kitchen / Dining Room with Pantry.
First floor - Off the first flor Landing with Built In Storage are Bedroom 1 with En-Suite Shower Room and the Family Bathroom.
Second floor - Off the second floor Landing are Bedroom 4, Inner Landing to Bedroom 2 with Walk-In Wardrobe, Bedroom 3 and Shower Room.
Third floor
 - To the third floor is a spacious Study.
Basement - To the Basement, off the Lower Landing with Store are the Media Room with Store Room, a Wine Cellar and the Utility.
Outside, the property has Electric Gates which give access to ample off road Driveway Parking and a Detached Timber Garage. There is a stone flagged Rear Patio with Koi Pond, extensive Rear Garden and superb wooded outlooks. To the front, the property is accessed via a listed, pedestrian Communal Gated Entranceway.
Situated slightly off Ashworth Road itself, this property has an enviable position amongst a truly wonderful setting. Country surroundings envelop the site of the original Ashworth Hall, with farmland, woodland and open fields too, while still being within reach of main road connections and commuter routes. Notable amenities nearby include The Bird at Birtle - one of Lancashire's best gastropubs, Gelder Wood Country Park and The Pavilions. Bury Grammar School is just 4 & 1/2 miles away and there are excellent range of local facilities in both Norden and Bamford, while Bury town centre with comprehensive shopping, leisure, health, sports & fitness, dining and entertainment options is just 10 minutes away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale Murrays Mills, Ancoats M4
about_property:
Two Bedroom
Two Bathroom
Dual Aspect
Original Features Throughout
Stunning Brickwork & Steelwork
EPC Rating C
24 Hour Concierge
Residents' Courtyard
Secure Bike Storage
Central Ancoats Location
This stunning two bedroom apartment is set within the award-winning Murrays' Mills development — one of the most desirable mill conversions in the city.
Situated in the historic New Mill, the apartment boasts generous living space and a wealth of original features, including exposed brickwork and iron beams.
Exclusively for owner occupiers, the development offers a 24-hour concierge service and a beautifully landscaped communal courtyard.
Viewings are highly recommended.
Murrays Mills
The Murray brothers began construction in 1797, starting with Old then Decker Mills. New Mill followed quickly, and the mills were then connected by linking wings. All but one wing remains, as do the engine houses and the chimney.
A beautiful conversion located in the heart of Ancoats, this development is made up of Grade II & II* listed buildings, a new build block and a stunning townhouse. Apartment 87 is located in New Mill. The development offers a 24 hour concierge, CCTV around the complex and gated access to the large communal courtyard. Murrays’ Mills is an owner occupier development and has a strong sense of community which makes it unique in Manchester.
The Tour
Located on the 1st floor of New Mill, this apartment shares the level with just one other apartment. Upon entry, you are greeted by a spacious hallway featuring oak hardwood timber flooring.
Open Plan Living/Kitchen Area: Hardwood timber flooring throughout, fully fitted Makintosh kitchen, tiled splash backs, stainless steel sink and drainer with Hansgrohe tap, integrated Neff cooker & hob, cda dishwasher, fridge and freezer. Wall mounted electric heaters, LED down lights throughout the kitchen & living space with two large windows over looking the stunning Courtyard.
Bedroom 1: Fully carpeted bedroom, offering a spacious fitted wardrobe, large window, LED down lights, TV and satellite points.
Bedroom 2: Oak hardwood timber flooring, large window, LED downlights.
The bathrooms are fitted with fully tiled flooring and Duravit 3 piece suites. The family bathroom has a shower over the bath, while the en-suite has a walk-in shower. Both bathrooms are adorned with Hansgrohe chrome fittings, a large mirror and vanity shelf with LED lighting, a heated chrome towel rail, downlights, and partially tiled walls.
The Area
Murrays' Mills is located in the heart on Ancoats, surrounded by many independent businesses including Mana, a Michelin star restaurant, Pollen, Rudys & general store. Across the road from Murrays' Mills is the Rochdale Canal and the ever popular Ancoats Marina perfect for a short walk or lunch spot on a summers day. Ancoats is also extremely close to the Northern Quarter & Piccadilly Train Station all within a 10-15 minute walk away.
Lease Information
- Service charge - £4544 per annum (paid quarterly)
- Ground rent - £325 per annum (no review for 15 years then reviewed with rpi every 10 years)
- Lease - 250 years from 2017

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale High Crest Avenue, Gatley, Stockport SK8
address: High Crest Avenue, Gatley, Stockport SK8
about_property:
Sought-after residential road close to Gatley Village
Within catchment for outstanding Gatley Primary School
Beautifully presented 1930s bay-fronted semi-detached home
Elegant bay-fronted dining room with Art Deco fireplace
Stylish living room with panelling, feature fireplace and French doors
Well-equipped galley kitchen with integrated appliances
Three well-proportioned bedrooms and four-piece family bathroom
Off-road parking, detached garage and private lawned rear garden
Planning permission granted for rear/side and dormer loft conversion.
A beautifully presented 1930s bay-fronted semi-detached home set on a sought-after residential road in Gatley, perfectly placed for the charming Gatley Village and the outstanding Gatley Primary School.
Description
Decorated and maintained to a high standard throughout, this characterful property combines period charm with stylish modern touches. The welcoming entrance hall, with its decorative hardwood front door and patterned glazing, sets the tone for the rest of the home. To the front, the elegant bay-fronted dining room features an attractive Art Deco fireplace and wooden flooring, while the separate living room offers stylish panelling, a feature fireplace, and French doors opening onto the patio area. The well-equipped galley kitchen boasts integrated appliances, tiled flooring with under-floor heating, and the practicality of an under-stairs WC.
Upstairs, three well-proportioned and beautifully decorated bedrooms are served by a contemporary four-piece family bathroom, complete with shower enclosure and separate bath. The rear bedroom offers far-reaching views over Manchester's skyline.
Other noteworthy features include the recently approved plans for a ground floor wrap around extension and dormer loft conversion allowing the opportunity for growth in the future.
Externally, the property enjoys off-road parking to the front, a detached garage to the rear, and an enclosed lawned garden providing a private and peaceful outdoor space.
Location
Cheadle offers a good selection of shops, pubs and restaurants and provides excellent educational facilities for children of all ages. Cheadle Royal Shopping Centre is close by together with access to the A34 by-pass which leads to Handforth Dean and Stanley Green Retail Park. Motorway connections to the M60 are available at both ends of the village, Manchester International Airport is easily accessible, whilst railway stations are situated at nearby Gatley and Cheadle Hulme.

This well-presented three-bedroom semi-detached property offers generous living space, modern touches, and a versatile layout, making it an ideal family home.

Lounge

about_property:

Nestled in a quiet residential cul-de-sac, Ashawe Grove, M38 0EE presents an ideal opportunity for first-time buyers, small families, or investors seeking a well-proportioned two-bedroom home in a convenient location. This delightful semi-detached property offers comfortable living spaces, generous gardens, and ample off-road parking – all within close proximity to local amenities, schools, and transport links.
Upon entering you're welcomed by a bright and inviting entrance hall that leads through to a spacious lounge. The lounge features a large window and French doors to the garden that fill the room with natural light, enhancing the sense of space and warmth. To the rear of the ground floor is a well-appointed fitted kitchen, complete with a range of base and wall units, ample worktop space, and integrated appliances. Adjacent to the kitchen is a convenient utility area that offers additional storage and functionality – ideal for housing white goods or creating a practical laundry space.
Upstairs, the first floor comprises two well-sized bedrooms, both offering comfortable accommodation and versatile layout options. The master bedroom benefits from generous proportions, while the second bedroom is perfectly suited for a child’s room, guest space, or home office. A modern family bathroom completes the first floor, featuring a clean and functional design with a three-piece suite. The loft has been fully boarded out with integrated ladder hatch and lighting for additional storage space.
Externally, the property continues to impress with a private driveway to the front providing off-road parking. The rear garden is of a good size and offers a secure and enclosed space – perfect for children, pets, or summer entertaining.
With GCH and double glazing throughout, this charming home is ready to move into but also offers scope for personalisation. Viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the potential and value on offer at this well-located address.
Entrance Hall
Radiator and stairs to first floor.
Lounge
Radiator, double glazed window and double glazed patio doors leading to rear garden area.
Kitchen
A range of low and eye level units incorporating a stainless steel sink and drainer unit, built in four ring hob, oven and grill, partly tiled walls, space for washing machine, wall mounted radiator, double glazed window, door to under stairs storage cupboard, door to utility area and door to inner hall
Inner Hall
Door to rear garden and front garden with doors to separate storage cupboard and utility room.
Utility Room
A range of low level units, space for fridge freezer and double glazed window.

Double glazed window and loft access with fully boarded loft and ladder which can be used for storage.
