Double glazed window and wall mounted radiator with storage cupboard.
Bedroom Two
Double glazed window and wall mounted radiator.
Bathroom
A three piece suite comprising of bath with shower over, vanity unit housing sink unit and low level WC, fully tiled walls and flooring, spot lights to ceiling, double glazed window and wall mounted stainless steel heated towel rail.
Outside
To the front of the property there is a paved driveway providing off road parking for numerous cars and to the rear of the property there is a lovely enclosed lawned garden, patio with raised planters full of flowers and plants making this a fantastic space for al fresco dining.

Set across three well-designed floors, the property features three generously sized bedrooms, providing comfortable and flexible living arrangements for families, professionals, or those in need of a home office. The master bedroom benefits from its own en-suite shower room, while the remaining bedrooms are served by a modern and well-appointed family bathroom—ideal for busy households.
At the heart of the home is a bright and airy open-plan living space, designed for modern living. The lounge flows seamlessly into the dining area and contemporary kitchen, creating an ideal setting for both everyday living and entertaining. From the dining area, there is direct access to the rear garden—perfect for summer evenings and al fresco dining.
On the ground floor, you’ll also find a practical utility room, a convenient downstairs WC, and a large integral garage. This garage offers fantastic versatility and could easily be transformed into an additional bedroom, home office, or second reception room, depending on your needs.
Externally, the property boasts a driveway with space for two vehicles, as well as an electric vehicle charging point—an increasingly desirable feature for modern homeowners. The rear garden provides a private outdoor retreat, ideal for families or simply enjoying a bit of green space in a peaceful setting.
Located just a short stroll from Prestwich Village, you’ll enjoy easy access to independent shops, cafés, excellent schools, and direct transport links into Manchester, all while benefiting from the quiet charm of this tucked-away residential enclave.

No chain! A truly unique opportunity to acquire a stunning Grade II listed five bedroom property measiuring over 4,300 sqft situated on approx a 1 acre plot. EPC - Exempt
Welcome to Park House, they don't build 'em like this anymore!
This is a rare opportunity to acquire a large five bedroom Grade II listed house steeped in local history dating back to c.1814 and beyond. It is said Winston Churchill even visited the property prior to him being elected as an Oldham mp in 1900.
Only appreciated by internal inspection and measuring over 4,300 sqft, this exceptionally spacious family home has lots of character and features.
This is perhaps a once in a generation opportunity to acquire such a prestige character property in this highly regarded location.
The property features stunning grand entrance hallway with parquet flooring, lounge also with parquet flooring, morning room, study, kitchen/diner, utility room, downstairs WC. Upstairs leads to large landing with picture window, a further WC, plus shower room, five large double bedrooms, washroom accessed via two of the bedrooms, plus a further family bathroom.
Externally, the property sits on a large plot measuring approx 1 acre with stunning mature gardens. The garden has been carefully curated to flourish in the pennine climate. There is also a gated driveway leading to a detached double garage to the rear which also has a tack room to the side. The property also has large cellar rooms which are full standing height and can be accessed externally, these rooms are ideal for potential conversion.
Situated just off Milnrow Road (A663) close to the junction with Buckstones Road - a location which has proved consistently popular. On the doorstep of stunning countryside such as Crompton Moor, yet within easy reach of Shaw town centre, the property is also well placed for popular local schools and provides easy access to the M62 to Leeds. Saddlewoth is also not far away, Shaw & Crompton Metrolink station is within walking distance providing easy access to Manchester.

Stamp Duty
Residential property rates
You usually pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (sdlt) on increasing portions of the property price when you buy residential property, for example a house or flat.
The amount you pay depends on:
• when you bought the property
• how much you paid for it
• whether you’re eligible for relief or an exemption
Rates for a single property
You pay sdlt at these rates if, after buying the property, it is the only residential property you own.
You will usually pay 5% on top of these rates if you own another residential property.
Rates from 1 April 2025
Property or lease premium or transfer value sdlt rate
Up to £125,000 Zero
The next £125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) 2%
The next £675,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £925,000) 5%
The next £575,000 (the portion from £925,001 to £1.5 million) 10%
The remaining amount (the portion above £1.5 million) 12%
Example
In April 2025 you buy a house for £295,000. The sdlt you owe will be calculated as follows:
• 0% on the first £125,000 = £0
• 2% on the second £125,000 = £2,500
• 5% on the final £45,000 = £2,250
• total sdlt = £4,750

As you approach this charming property, you’re immediately struck by its welcoming presence. Boasting a well-maintained garden frontage and a spacious driveway offering ample off-road parking for multiple vehicles, the home also benefits from a detached garage, perfect for additional storage or workshop use.
Upon entering, you’re greeted by a bright and spacious entrance hall, setting the tone for the generous proportions throughout. To the front of the home is a beautifully presented living room, complete with a large bay window that floods the space with natural light and a feature fireplace that adds character and warmth.
To the rear, you’ll find a versatile second reception room, currently used as a formal dining room, with patio door access directly into the rear garden – ideal for entertaining or family meals with a garden view. The kitchen, also overlooking the rear garden, is a practical and functional space with plenty of scope for modernisation or reconfiguration to suit your lifestyle.
Upstairs, the home continues to impress. There are two generous double bedrooms, both featuring fitted wardrobes, providing excellent storage solutions. The third bedroom is notably larger than average and would make an ideal nursery, home office, or guest room. Completing the first floor is the family bathroom, well-proportioned and ready for your personal touch.
To the rear, the property truly comes into its own. The extensive garden offers a tranquil and private space, perfect for families, avid gardeners, or those who love to entertain outdoors. With a generous lawned area, established borders, and plenty of space to play or relax, it’s a rare find in such a well-connected location.
This property offers fantastic potential for those looking to modernise, personalise, or even extend (subject to the relevant planning permissions), making it an exciting prospect for families or investors alike.

It is also located within the catchment area of reputable local schools, and just minutes from Crown Point Retail Park, local shops, and other essential amenities.
This is a rare opportunity to secure a spacious family home in a prime location with scope to add value – early viewing is highly recommended!

Nestled in the charming area of Beehive Green, Westhoughton, this beautifully presented true bungalow offers a delightful living experience. With two well-proportioned bedrooms and a spacious reception room, this property is perfect for a variety of buyers, whether you are a first-time homeowner, a small family, or looking to downsize.
The bungalow boasts a large rear garden, providing an ideal outdoor space for relaxation, gardening, or entertaining guests. The garden is a true highlight, offering ample room for children to play or for you to enjoy peaceful moments in the fresh air.
Inside, the property is tastefully decorated throughout, ensuring a warm and inviting atmosphere. The layout is practical and functional, making the most of the available space. The bathroom is conveniently located, serving both bedrooms and the living area.
Situated in a quiet and friendly neighbourhood, this bungalow is close to local amenities, schools, and transport links, making it a convenient choice for everyday living.
This property truly caters to a wide range of buyers, offering comfort, style, and a wonderful garden to enjoy. Do not miss the opportunity to make this lovely bungalow your new home.
To conform with government Money Laundering Regulations 2019, we are required to confirm the identity of all prospective buyers. We use the services of a third party called credas. There is a nominal charge of £50 excluding VAT for this (per person).
Lounge
This welcoming lounge is a bright and relaxing space, featuring a large front-facing window that fills the room with natural light. The room is tastefully decorated with a feature wall and a mounted television, complemented by a comfortable seating area that invites you to unwind.
Kitchen
This kitchen is efficiently designed with modern white cabinetry and dark countertops, creating a clean and contemporary aesthetic. It includes integrated appliances and a convenient window above the sink that offers a pleasant view of the garden, while providing ample workspace and storage.
Bedroom 1
Bedroom 1 is a comfortable double room that benefits from natural light through a side-facing window. The room is beautifully presented with a calming colour scheme and decorative mirror above the bed, creating a restful and inviting atmosphere.
Bedroom 2
Bedroom 2 is a well-proportioned room. It enjoys plenty of daylight from a front-facing window and is decorated in neutral tones, making it a flexible space to suit a variety of needs.
Bathroom
The bathroom is fitted with modern white tiling and includes a corner shower cubicle, a contemporary basin with storage beneath, and a toilet. A frosted window allows natural light in while maintaining privacy, completing this fresh and practical space.
Hallway
The hallway provides access to the main rooms of the property and is decorated with neutral flooring and simple white walls. It creates a welcoming entrance and a practical flow through the home.
Rear Garden
The rear garden is a generous outdoor space with a well-maintained lawn bordered by a paved patio area. It features a seating area with garden furniture and a built-in barbecue setup, perfect for entertaining or relaxing in the sunshine. The garden is enclosed by fencing, providing privacy and a safe space for children or pets.
Front Exterior
The front exterior of the property features a well-kept driveway and lawn area with mature trees providing shade and privacy. The brick facade and tiled roof give the property a classic and welcoming appearance, with a paved path leading to the front door.

There are both ofsted rated Good and Outstanding educational & child care settings making this the ideal area for some families. Patricroft benefits from local supermarkets such as Lidl, Aldi, Morrisons, West One Retail Park and many local Mini Markets and takeaway shops. Eccles recreation Ground offers an outdoor green space and playing area as well as an outdoor gym.

display_address: Bolton Street, Ramsbottom, Bury, Greater Manchester BL0
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale Bolton Street, Ramsbottom, Bury, Greater Manchester BL0
address: Bolton Street, Ramsbottom, Bury, Greater Manchester BL0
about_property:
Incredible victorian family home
Sought after location in ramsbottom
Substantial accommodation boasting character throughout
Two parking spaces & impressive garden to the rear
Garden room could be utilised as A home gym or office
Beautifully presented throughout
A rare gem!
Exceptional Victorian Residence in the Heart of Ramsbottom
This magnificent Victorian home occupies a prime position in the heart of Ramsbottom village, offering a rare combination of generous proportions, elegant period features, and a high-quality contemporary finish. Immaculately presented throughout, the property retains its imposing period charm, showcasing features such as sash windows, original wood flooring, intricate coving, panelled shutters, and a striking Victorian tiled floor, all seamlessly blended with modern-day comforts.
Perfectly situated within walking distance of Ramsbottom’s vibrant shops, restaurants, and highly regarded schools, and just a short drive from excellent motorway connections, this home combines convenience with timeless character.
Accommodation is arranged over three storeys and briefly comprises:
A welcoming entrance vestibule with original Victorian tiled floor leads into a stunning hallway with original wood flooring and access to one of the cellar rooms which is used for storage. The beautifully appointed lounge features a bay window with panelled shutters, a feature fireplace and elegant period detailing. The breakfast kitchen boasts a centre island, granite and wood worktops, and a double Belfast sink, aga and fridge/freezer, flowing into the open-plan sitting room with access to the rear courtyard. A useful utility room and guest WC complete the ground floor.
The gallery landing, with its remarkable full-length arch window, leads to the master suite – a luxurious space with sash window views, a large dressing room, and a stylish four-piece en-suite. Two further bedrooms are on this level, one with en-suite facilities. The second floor houses a light-filled double bedroom with Velux windows, and en-suite bathroom.
Externally, the property enjoys a good-sized plot with an enclosed front garden and a rear block-paved courtyard with access to the second cellar room. Beyond lies a large, private garden with lawn, composite decked seating areas, and a detached insulated garden room with double doors and power perfect as a home office or entertaining space. Two allocated parking spaces are provided to the rear. The property also benefits from a new boiler which provides separate heating upstairs and downstairs installed approximately 18 months ago and double glazing throughout.
A truly outstanding Victorian home, offering space, character, and modern luxury in one of Ramsbottom’s most desirable locations. Viewing is essential to appreciate the scale and quality of accommodation on offer.
Lease Term : 999 years from 11 June 1879
Rent : £10.2s.

Well Presented
Situated at the top of a quiet cul-de-sac, this well presented two-bedroom home effortlessly combines period charm with modern touches. The property benefits from driveway parking and is set in a peaceful location, making it an ideal retreat while still being conveniently located.
Upon entering the home, you are welcomed by a bright hallway that showcases the original internal doors and staircase, giving a warm and characterful first impression. Under the stairs, a practical storage cupboard houses the boiler and is plumbed for a washing machine. To the front of the house is a cosy reception room featuring a charming wrought iron fireplace and a large bay window, flooding the space with natural light.
To the rear of the property, a spacious open-plan room creates a wonderful space for modern living. This area incorporates a comfortable lounge with a wood burner, a dining area with French doors opening directly onto the garden, and a well-designed shaker-style kitchen complete with a range of fitted cupboards. It’s a perfect space for entertaining or enjoying family time, with a seamless flow between indoors and outdoors.
Upstairs, the master bedroom is generously sized and positioned at the front of the house. With dual windows and a classic picture rail, it’s a bright and elegant space. The second bedroom is also a large double, overlooking the rear garden. The bathroom is tastefully fitted with a large walk-in shower, WC, and a stylish vanity sink unit, offering a luxurious and contemporary feel.
The rear garden is a true highlight of the property. Westerly facing, it enjoys the afternoon and evening sun, with steps leading down to a well-maintained lawn and colourful flower borders. To the side, a dedicated kitchen garden allows for the growing of a variety of vegetables, lovingly tended by the current owner. An unexpected and unique feature is the original Anderson shelter situated at the side of the property — a fascinating historical touch that adds further character.
This home is full of charm, from its original features to its modern comforts, and is ideal for buyers looking for a quiet yet connected lifestyle in a welcoming and attractive setting.

display_address: The Pump House, Standish, Wigan WN1
title: 5 bed detached house for sale The Pump House, Standish, Wigan WN1
address: The Pump House, Standish, Wigan WN1
about_property:
The Pump House is an impressive fusion of contemporary architecture, luxury family living, and peaceful sanctuary — all wrapped in over 7,000 sq ft of exceptional space and nestled within 4.5 acres of private grounds. Elevated above a tranquil wooded valley with landscaped gardens cascading down to the river below, this magnificent home offers unrivalled privacy, awe-inspiring design, and a standard of living that must be seen to be fully appreciated.
From the tree-lined driveway and bold architectural form to the exquisite interiors, bedroom suites, designer kitchen, multiple reception rooms, home cinema, indoor swimming pool and home gym — this is family life at its most refined. Located just moments from the amenities of Standish village, acclaimed schools, and key transport links, The Pump House is a home that delivers the very best of both worlds.
An Impressive Approach
The house is so discreetly positioned that if nobody told you it was here, you’d never know it existed. Accessed via electric gates, a tree-lined driveway opens to landscaped grounds and reveals the home in all its grandeur — perfectly framed by lush greenery and manicured lawns.
The main parking area is large enough for a whole fleet of cars, and the home welcomes you inside through a supersize bespoke solid oak door with glass surrounds, giving you the first impression of the grand proportions found throughout. A handy porch leads through to the central reception hall where you immediately notice the stylish oak and glass staircase, plus the abundance of natural light pouring in through the huge skylight window and glass wall at the rear.
The Designer Kitchen
The heart of the home is the exceptional designer kitchen and daily dining area — a breathtaking space with plentiful glass and panoramic views of the gardens and valley below. Bifold doors and three sets of French doors open onto a vast elevated composite deck, creating seamless indoor-outdoor living.
Designed and installed by the renowned Stuart Frazer, this premium Siematic kitchen features minimalist cabinetry, ambient recessed lighting, and deep Corian worktops. Every detail has been considered — from the walk-in pantry to the well-tailored storage and integral larder cabinets.
A selection of Miele appliances includes two conventional ovens with warming drawers, a microwave, steam oven, full-length fridge and dishwasher. Additional highlights include a Bora induction hob with built-in downdraft extractor, a Quooker tap with instant boiling, chilled and sparkling water, a Liebherr full-length freezer, and twin Monogram wine fridges.
At the centre is an enormous island with a contrasting dark oak breakfast bar — a stunning and practical hub for everyday family life, relaxed weekends, or entertaining. Whether it's Sunday brunch, evening drinks with friends, or summer barbecues spilling out onto the decking, this space is made to be enjoyed.
Reception Rooms
The Pump House offers four distinct reception rooms, each delivering space, comfort, and flexibility for the modern family.
The main lounge is a showstopper — around 33 sq m in size, with a vaulted double-height ceiling, six-panel bifold doors, and a stylish glass inset log burner within a towering chimney breast and gallery landing above. It’s a room made for hosting on a grand scale or unwinding in total comfort.
Next door, the media room offers another luxurious lounge experience, with floor-to-ceiling windows by day and a full cinema set-up by night — blackout blinds, projector screen, and surround sound at the touch of a button. It’s ideal as a cinema, games room or teenage retreat.
On the opposite side of the reception hall, the formal dining room enjoys an abundance of natural light, with French doors opening onto a covered al-fresco dining terrace. Perfect for dinner parties and special occasions, it blends elegance with atmosphere.
Adjoining the kitchen is a peaceful day lounge — currently a relaxed sitting room with more French doors onto the garden. It’s the perfect spot for morning coffee, a children's playroom, or a snug for reading and relaxation.
Practical Aspects
Functionality is fully considered, with a separate plant room, utility, guest WC, ample cloak storage, and a large, fully equipped home office designed for two people. A unique bonus is the first-floor laundry room — located near the bedrooms and complete with plumbing, sink, and generous storage.
Bedrooms & Bathrooms
The entire first floor benefits from vaulted ceilings and striking architectural lines. Full-height apex windows and walls of glass frame tranquil green views from every room.
Each of the five double bedrooms has its own sleek three-piece en-suite with tiled surrounds and modern fittings, all immaculately maintained. The master suite adds a walk-in dressing room and a stunning private balcony beneath an apex roof — your own peaceful morning sanctuary just steps from the bed.
Leisure Facilities
The indoor swimming pool is a standout feature, newly refurbished and upgraded with a Calorex system in 2025. Enjoy year-round heated swimming with a swim-jet system for endless laps, plus a hot tub, skylights, floor-to-ceiling windows, and bifold doors connecting you back to the neighbouring nature.
Accessed via a covered walkway from the house and also from the first floor via a spiral staircase, it’s a true private spa experience. A home gym links the gallery landing to the pool hall — equally suited to yoga or conversion into a wellness suite or sauna.
A Luxury Finish
From the moment you enter, the luxury is unmistakable — bespoke oak joinery and flooring, natural stone tiling, gallery landings, vast proportions, and world-class appliances throughout.
A Control4 smart home system allows you to manage lighting, heating, and audio from your phone, delivering comfort and convenience with every touch.
Gardens, Grounds & Garages
Set on approximately 4.5 acres with no neighbours in sight, this is more than a home — it's a countryside retreat. The gated driveway delivers complete seclusion and leads to a shale-surfaced parking area, triple garage, and carport with EV charging point.
To the rear, a full-width composite deck with glass balustrades offers a breath-taking entertaining space overlooking the valley and river. It’s piled into the ground for structural integrity and generously sized to accommodate sun loungers, dining zones, or even an outdoor kitchen if desired.
The surrounding grounds include manicured lawns, landscaped borders, rockeries, and mature trees. To one side, Japanese-inspired tiered lawns step down to a large wildlife pond, offering a magical connection to the river and nature. A children’s treehouse completes the picture — making this a truly special home for every generation.
Location
Despite its extraordinary privacy, The Pump House is just moments from the bustling and sought-after village of Standish — home to a wide selection of independent shops, cafes, restaurants, gyms, supermarkets, and top-rated schools.
The M6 motorway is a short drive away, placing Manchester, Preston, and the wider North West within easy commuting distance. This rare combination of peace, privacy, and connectivity makes the location just as impressive as the home itself.
Specific Details
Council Tax Band: H
Tenure: Freehold
Heating: Gas boiler and tank with water-based underfloor heating throughout
Drainage: Private septic tank
Utilities: Mains gas, electricity, and water
Security: Full alarm system with CCTV
Smart Home: Control4 automation system

title: 6 bed detached house for sale Langham Road, Bowdon WA14
about_property:
Beautifully renovated period home
Bowdon conservation area
Secure gated entrance
Private and convenient location
Stunning interior
Superb principal suite
Private rear garden
EPC Rating = C
One of the finest examples of a beautifully renovated period property in the Bowdon conservation area.
Description
Nestled in the picturesque Bowdon conservation area, the Red House is a shining example of an exceptionally well crafted and fully renovated six-bedroom detached period residence.
Dating back to 1903 and retaining a wealth of period features, the vendors have meticulously blended the elegance of this imposing Edwardian home with an exacting classical finish, lavishing attention to detail throughout.
The solid oak front door, adorned with original stained and leaded windows, opens into the timelessly elegant wood panelled and tiled entrance hall, reminiscent of a bygone era. The ground floor comprises generously sized rooms: A large open plan living dining kitchen, formal living room, dining room, executive study and utility boot room. Particular mention must be made of the open plan kitchen, diner which extends to over 500 sq ft. It is flooded with natural light and benefits from opening out onto a large sun terrace overlooking the garden below.
The kitchen, with underfloor heating includes a variety of integrated appliances by Fisher Paykel and Neff, including a double oven with warming drawer, wine fridge, dishwasher and both gas and induction hobs, all housed in bespoke wall drawer and base units, complemented by quartz stone work surfaces. A WC and cloakroom storage complete the ground floor.
Two staircases complete with brass hand rails provide access to the lower ground floor where there is a large family cinema room complete with stylish bar area, a games room, gymnasium, small utility area and WC. The vendors have cleverly retained and exposed some of the original brickwork in the hallway as a feature and all rooms have their own access to the terrace and gardens beyond.
To the first floor, the principal suite is generously sized, offering stylish fitted wardrobes housed in a separate dressing area, and a sizeable en-suite with freestanding tub, shower and marble topped sink unit. The bedroom has the benefit of a lovely sit on balcony overlooking the gardens below. The first floor is completed by a further three bedrooms all of which are doubles, serviced by a large family bathroom. A further two double bedrooms, family bathroom and large open seating area can be found to the second floor. A versatile space which could be easily adapted for live in relatives.
Additional features include Sonos sound system, commercial Wi-Fi and Strongbox security system. What is evident whilst meandering through this beautiful family home is the use of quality materials, and seamless interior design, bringing a calming feel and cohesive flow throughout.
Externally, electric gates provide access to a substantial gravel forecourt set well back from the road and offering parking for numerous vehicles, in addition there is a single garage with an electric car charging point.
The rear gardens have been cleverly designed to offer a good mixture of grass laid to lawn, raised sun deck and a large covered dining and seating area complete with electrics and lighting, perfect for outdoor entertaining on summer evenings. Beautifully stocked borders and hedging to the perimeters, ensure a high degree of privacy.
Location
Nestled in a prestigious conservation area, this residence enjoys a private setting yet remains conveniently close to local amenities being easily walkable to the nearest villages.
The property is superbly placed for access to the many amenities of fashionable Hale village and the town of Altrincham with their impressive range of restaurants, bistros and bars, specialist shops, cinema, artisan markets and supermarkets. The property is well positioned, walking distance to both Altrincham and Hale centres.
The area offers Golf courses, leisure clubs and facilities for outdoor pursuits, the National Trust’s Dunham Massey Hall and park are close by and the Bollin valley and Cheshire countryside are on the doorstep.
Access to the M56, M60 and M6 offer easy commuter links to the North West’s principal commercial centres and Manchester Airport. Altrincham Metro Link provides quick and easy access to the City centre.
The educational establishments available locally are considered among the best in the Manchester area, with Altrincham Grammar, Loreto, St Ambrose, as well as outstanding preparatory and state junior schools such as Bowdon Church. There are local bus stops to Manchester Grammar, Manchester High, Withington and many of the other private schools in the area.
Square Footage: 4,767 sq ft
Additional Info
Council Tax Band G

A fabulous, ready-to-move-into, stylish apartment located on the first floor of the original, iconic Birch Hill Clocktower building, boasting fantastic far-reaching, south-facing views. This beautiful home benefits from new energy-efficient storage heaters, a newly installed media wall, and luxury vinyl tile (lvt) flooring, adding to its modern appeal.
Perfectly positioned for convenient access to local amenities, including shops, transport links to neighbouring towns and villages, and a variety of bars, restaurants, and supermarkets. Mainline train stations at Smithy Bridge and Littleborough provide direct routes to Leeds and Manchester, while the stunning Hollingworth Lake and Watergrove Reservoir are just a short drive away.
Light and bright throughout, the apartment is beautifully presented with sash windows and, in places, impressive floor-to-ceiling windows. The accommodation briefly comprises: A welcoming entrance hall with a generous storage room, a large lounge and dining area with open-plan kitchen, two double bedrooms with quality fitted wardrobes, an en-suite shower room to the master, and a further modern bathroom.
This apartment also includes two allocated private parking spaces (the only plot in the development to have two), plus additional visitor parking. Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the style, setting, and unique features this home offers.

Newly laid lvt flooring runs throughout, adding a sleek and modern touch. A recently installed media wall with integrated storage provides both style and functionality. The generous dining area easily accommodates a large family dining table and is beautifully enhanced by a striking floor-to-ceiling window.
Kitchen
Open to the living area, this modern, good-quality kitchen features a stylish range of wall and base units, complemented by integrated appliances including a fridge freezer, oven, electric hob with extractor hood, and a washing machine. The open-plan design creates a seamless flow, ideal for both everyday living and entertaining.

Balcony

Exceptionally unique, an apartment with an abundance of character in the popular Smithfield's Buildings, ideally located in Manchester's Northern Quarter!
Description
In the heart of the Northern Quarter, where Manchester’s creative spirit comes alive, lies a home that’s as full of personality as the neighbourhood itself.
Savills is proud to present this exceptional two bedroom, split level apartment within the renowned Smithfield Buildings, a landmark steeped in history and brimming with character.
From the moment you step inside, the space opens into an impressive open plan living, dining, and kitchen area. Soaring ceilings, exposed brickwork, and an abundance of natural light set the stage for both stylish entertaining and quiet relaxation. The kitchen is a contemporary design, with integrated appliances blending seamlessly into the industrial charm. Just off the lounge, a private terrace provides a peaceful spot to enjoy your morning coffee or evening glass of wine.
Tucked to the right upon entry of the lower level is a comfortable double bedroom set a top staircase to the mezzanine level. This section offers clever built in storage and could be utilised as a second bedroom, or for another purpose as imagined.
To the centre of the apartment are a separate set of stairs, in which you’ll discover a versatile study or home office, perfect for remote working or creative projects. Continue upwards from here and you'll find the primary bedroom. Light pours in through the skylight above, while the private en suite ensures a touch of everyday luxury.
Smithfield Building is positioned right at the heart of Manchester's famous Northern Quarter. Formerly home to Affleck and Brown, the development was transformed into stunning loft apartments with commercial space underneath in the mid-late nineties.
Offering a rare blend of heritage and heart, this home is every bit as unique as its iconic location.
EWS1 Form and cover letter completed March 2025 available with A2 rating!
General disclaimers: We are advised there are works to the building due relating to the roof. Further information can be requested via the local office. We are also further advised a nearby car park is due to be converted into apartments, any further information requested should be sought from the local planning authority.
Location
Smithfield buildings is in an excellent Northern Quarter location close to all Manchester has to offer.
Victoria tram and train links (0.4m), Manchester Piccadilly (0.5m) and the Arndale shopping centre (0.3m) are all within easy reach.
Deansgate is also situated nearby (0.7m) with a host of restaurants, bars and attractions perfect to enjoy city centre living.
You are also not far from sport and entertainment options. Manchester's famous football stadiums Old Trafford (home to Manchester United) and the Etihad (home to Manchester City) are 4.1m and 1.7m away respectively.
For cultural activities locally, residents are situated near to Manchester's famous Northern Quarter (0.1m) which offers a variety of leisure and nightlife activities.
Please note all distances quoted are approximate.

Leasehold with approximately 970 years remaining.

The ground rent is fixed and is not reviewed/escalated.

To the first floor there are two good sized double bedrooms, the master having an ensuite shower room, and two further spacious single bedrooms. The family bathroom is fitted with a four piece suite including shower cubicle, panelled bath, WC and washbasin.
There is a lovely private garden area to the rear of the property.
Fitzroy Street is situated just off Huddersfield Road in the popular Stalybridge area of Tameside. Ideally positioned for easy access to local shops, schools and amenities including Active Copley, the property is also just a short distance from Stalybridge and its excellent range of shops and transport links including Stalybridge station.
The property is also conveniently placed for access to Saddleworth and its numerous attractions and villages including Greenfield, with its wonderful walks around Dovestone Reservoir and the Peak District National Park and Uppermill, with canal boats tours and a fantastic array of shops, cafés and public houses.
*The property is currently rented at £1500pcm on a rolling basis to an assisted care provider but can also be sold on a vacant possession basis.*

title: 3 bed detached house for sale Chilham Road, Worsley, Manchester M28
about_property:
Fantastic Modern detached property, ready to move into
Attractive and stylish lounge
Impressive open plan kitchen/Diner
Three immaculate bedrooms
Beautiful landscaped large sunny rear garden
Perfect first time buy for families or buy to let investment
Popular residential location with excellent schools, amenities and commuter links
Potential for further extensions to the property
No Chain – Newly Decorated And Ready To Move Into In The Heart Of Walkden
This beautifully presented and recently redecorated three-bedroom property offers bright, airy living spaces and a well-designed layout, making it perfect for families, first-time buyers, or those seeking a comfortable downsize. Situated just off the A6 and right in the heart of Walkden, the home enjoys an exceptional location – only 2 minutes’ walk (0.3 miles) from Walkden train station and 3 minutes’ walk (0.5 miles) from Ellesmere Shopping Centre – making it highly sought-after and in strong demand.
A welcoming hallway leads into the attractive and stylish lounge, where a beautiful bay window at the front looks over the neat, small front garden and floods the room with natural light. Light oak wooden flooring flows seamlessly throughout the ground floor, and a gas fireplace creates a cosy focal point. An internal door opens into the generous kitchen/diner at the rear, fitted with light brown cupboards, black marble-effect countertops, an electric oven and grill, gas hob, and cooker hood. There is space for freestanding appliances, including a fridge-freezer and washing machine. The breakfast bar and dining area provide ample room for family meals, and patio doors open to a very private rear garden.
Upstairs, the landing leads to two spacious double bedrooms and a versatile box room, ideal for a single bed, home office, or dressing room. The family bathroom is fully tiled in cream from floor to ceiling for easy maintenance and features both a separate bath and a shower cubicle.
Outside, the property benefits from a newly laid large patio area, creating the perfect setting for entertaining, and a very private garden with ample space for outdoor fun with family and friends. The front garden adds further curb appeal.
With its fresh décor, move-in-ready finish, and unbeatable location close to transport, shops, and schools, this property is an opportunity not to be missed. Early viewing is highly recommended.

about_property:
Lifestyle Sales and Lettings are delighted to bring to the market this one bedroom semi-detached bungalow set in a popular location just off Walmersley Road which presents an excellent opportunity for both homeowners and investors alike.
The property comprises, lounge, bathroom, hallway, kitchen and a bedroom. The property benefits from gas central heating, double glazing where specified, a front and side driveway with ample space for parking and an enclosed rear yard.
As it is within walking distance to Bury Town Centre, it has convenient access to local amenities, parks, reputable schools, and excellent transport links into Manchester City Centre and surrounding areas, this home offers both practicality and potential.
Whether you're a first-time buyer looking for a manageable property, a downsizer, or an investor, this property presents a fantastic opportunity.
In need of modernisation, it allows the new owner to add their personal touch and create a home tailored to their taste and needs.
Currently tenanted, the bungalow provides a reliable rental income of £700.00 per month and £8400,00 per annum, translating to a strong gross yield of approximately 7% based on the asking price of £120,000. This makes it a highly attractive option for investors seeking a steady income stream.
Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the potential on offer – a must-see!

No chain. A spacious semi-detached home set in a generous corner plot abutting countryside in sought-after Diggle. Ideal for growing families, viewing is considered essential. EPC: Tbc.
Offering over 1,200 square feet of accommodation, plus useful eaves storage, this well-presented semi-detached home offers versatile family-sized accommodation in an enviable position.
Personal inspection will reveal an entrance hall with useful under-stairs storage and a large lounge with double doors leading out to the rear garden. The dining room is ideal for more formal gatherings, with the kitchen/breakfast room perfect for casual dining. The kitchen is fitted with a range of modern matching units and integrated appliances including an electric hob, oven/grill and fridge-freezer and offers access to the side garden.
The ground floor is completed by a large double bedroom and a modern shower room.
To the first floor there are two further double bedrooms, the principle bedroom utilising a feature window to showcase the stunning countryside views. A modern en-suite shower room completes the accommodation.
Warmed by a gas central heating system with combination boiler, the economy and comfort are enhanced further by uPVC double glazed windows. In addition, there is a large useful eaves storage area accessed off the second bedroom.
Externally set in a generous plot which extends to over 1/10 of an acre and includes a potting shed, storage shed, mature lawns, patio seating area and woodland. Off-road parking for a minimum of two vehicles is available via a driveway to the front.
Ravenstones Drive can be located just off Ward Lane and in turn Huddersfield Road in the popular Saddleworth village of Diggle. Ideally located for easy access to local amenities and neighbouring villages including Delph, Dobcross and Uppermill, with its local shops, cafés, pubs and recreational facilities including Uppermill park, museum and canal boats tours, this would prove an ideal choice.
The property is also just a short distance from the new Saddleworth School, making this an ideal choice for a family home.

A wonderfully spacious mid-terraced home set in a highly convenient position in popular Mossley. Benefitting from three bedrooms and a loft area, viewing comes highly recommended. EPC: Tbc.
Offering an impressive 860 square feet on accommodation, plus a large, useful loft area, this deceptive mid-terraced home should appeal to a variety of purchasers.
Personal inspection will reveal an entrance vestibule which leads swiftly into a bright & spacious lounge and a modern kitchen fitted with a range of matching units and integrated appliances including a gas hob, oven & grill and dishwasher.
To the first floor viewers will find three good-sized bedrooms and a luxury three-piece shower room comprising of a low-level WC, hand wash basin and walk-in shower unit with rainfall shower.

**backing onto fields**
 This Beautifully Presented, Three Large Double Bedroom Semi-Detached Property Provides an Abundance of Space! Significantly Extended, with a Large Plot Plus Outbuildings!
Located in the popular Astley area, the property benefits from close access to a fine array of restaurants, pubs and cafes. It’s also close to excellent transport links into both Manchester City Centre and to Warrington.
This lovely property was built in 1936 and has been thoughtfully updated throughout by the current owner. Please see the owner’s comments section further down for even more information!
As you enter the property you go into a welcoming entrance hallway, which provides access to a downstairs utility room with a W/C. This room features a quartz worktop and a double sink. Additionally, there is storage under the stairs. From the hallway, you also flow through to the huge, extended open plan living, dining and kitchen area, which boasts a Velux window and bi-folding doors that let plenty of natural light in.

Upstairs, from the landing you will find
three double bedrooms
, each with fitted furniture, and with an ensuite to the main bedroom. Completing the internal accommodation is the four-piece bathroom which is complete with a plunge bath, a shower, sink and W/C.
Externally, there is a driveway to the side for off-road parking, along with a beautifully maintained garden to the front with mature plants. A real selling point of this property is the fantastic garden at the rear, complete with laid-to-lawn grass, paving and mature plants.
It also boasts outbuildings with electric, which are currently used as a gym and an office/podcast room.

about_property:
Delph
Modern end-townhouse
Beautifully presented
Two bedrooms

Allocated residents parking
Short walk to local amenities

This well presented, end town house is set on a popular development in sought after Delph. The property is located close to excellent local amenities and is within close walking distance of the village centre. Viewing comes highly recommended. EPC: C.
Personal inspection of this modern end-townhouse will reveal an entrance hall with stairs to the first floor and a generously sized guest WC just off, a doorway leads to a modern, open plan lounge/dining/kitchen area.
The kitchen itself is fitted with a range of modern matching units and integrated appliances including an electric hob, oven/grill, slimline dishwasher, fridge-freezer and washing machine. Double doors lead out to the rear garden.
To the first floor there are two bedrooms one with fitted wardrobes and family bathroom comprising of a low-level WC, hand wash basin and panelled bath with shower over. There is also a generously sized storage area which is accessed via a doorway on the landing.
Warmed by a gas central heating system with combination boiler, the economy and comfort are enhanced further by uPVC double glazed windows.
Externally, the property is set in a pleasant, traffic-free position within a corner plot. It is fully enclosed with a patio area at the front and a larger garden at the rear. The front area has hard wired lighting and is gated. The rear garden features artificial grass and a further patio area. The garden is not over-looked, and the surrounding area boasts a picturesque route which follows the River Tame back into the centre of Delph village centre.
Bakestones Avenue can be accessed from Huddersfield Road and sits within the popular village of Delph. This popular village boasts a range of amenities including a post office, convenience store, library and the popular Millgate Theatre. There are good bus links to surrounding areas. There are excellent schools locally.

The property opens to a welcoming hallway leading to a generous lounge/dining room with a charming bay window that floods the space with natural light and offers leafy views. The modern fitted kitchen features sleek high-gloss cabinetry, integrated oven and hob, and ample worktop space, making it both stylish and practical.
There are two well-proportioned bedrooms. The principal bedroom boasts fitted wardrobes and a contemporary ensuite shower room, while the second double bedroom is served by a modern family bathroom with a full suite and over-bath shower. Both bathrooms are finished with quality tiling.
Exterior & Communal Areas
The apartment sits within a secure, low-rise brick building surrounded by manicured lawns, palm trees, and mature shrubs. Residents benefit from well-kept communal areas, allocated parking, and visitor bays.
Location
The development enjoys a prime position in a desirable residential area. There are a variety of everyday amenities close by, including supermarkets, cafes, and restaurants. For leisure, nearby green spaces such as Doffcocker Lodge Nature Reserve and Moss Bank Park offer scenic walking trails, play areas, and wildlife.
Families will appreciate the proximity to highly regarded schools, including both primary and secondary options within easy reach, such as St Thomas's CE Primary School and Bolton School, known for its strong academic reputation.
Excellent transport connections make commuting straightforward. The property is within easy reach of Bolton town centre, with its shopping, dining, and cultural attractions, while road links to the M61 and A666 provide swift access to Manchester, Preston, and beyond. Public transport options include nearby bus routes and rail services from Bolton Station, connecting to Manchester in around 20 minutes.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale Wakefield Road, Stalybridge, Greater Manchester SK15

about_property:
Freehold - Council Tax Band E
Character property built around 1836
High ceilings throughout
Spacious lounge with fireplace & bay window
Separate dining room
Two bathrooms
Attic & basement

Spacious and well-presented detached home offering four bedrooms with potential for a fifth in the attic, generous parking, and double glazing throughout. Situated in a desirable Stalybridge location close to schools, parks, local amenities, and exce
Built around 1836, this remarkable four-bedroom detached home combines historical grandeur with modern comfort, offering generous proportions, elegant period features, and stunning panoramic views.
From its elevated position, the property commands an impressive presence, with its stone facade, original detailing, and mature gardens behind wrought iron railings. Off-road parking is plentiful, ensuring convenience alongside kerb appeal.
Step inside through a striking stained-glass doorway and into a large, welcoming hallway, where the scale and character of the home are immediately apparent. Two substantial reception rooms, each adorned with high ceilings, ornate cornicing, large bay windows, and polished wooden floors, provide both formal and informal living options. The main lounge features a beautiful fireplace, while the dining room offers ample space for entertaining.
The country-style kitchen is well-appointed with wooden worktops, integrated appliances, and a charming breakfast bar, complemented by a useful utility room. Downstairs, a unique cellar bar creates a truly distinctive leisure space - perfect for hosting friends or enjoying a cosy evening in.
Upstairs, there are four spacious double bedrooms, each with its own character. The principal bedroom boasts a period fireplace and plenty of natural light. A luxurious family bathroom offers both a walk-in shower and a separate bath, while a second bathroom retains a classic roll-top tub for added indulgence.
The second floor reveals a vast games room - currently housing a full-sized snooker table - with the potential to be converted into a fifth bedroom, studio, or office.
Situated within easy reach of excellent local schools, transport links to Manchester, Leeds, and beyond, scenic walking trails, parks, and a range of local shops, cafes, and restaurants, this is a rare opportunity to acquire a home that blends heritage, space, and lifestyle flexibility in one outstanding package.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale Birches Road, Turton, Bolton, 0 BL7
about_property:
Four-Bedroom Semi-Detached Stone Farmhouse
Idyllic Rural Setting Close To Edgworth
Glass-Roofed Conservatory With Panoramic Views
Award-Winning Lounge With Double-Sided Fireplace
Character Dining Room With Exposed Oak Beams
Contemporary Kitchen With Breakfast Bar Seating
Main Bedroom With En-Suite Shower Room
Luxury Family Bathroom With Rainfall Shower
Landscaped Gardens With Multiple Seating Areas
Integral Double Garage And Ample Driveway Parking For 6
Spacious 4-Bedroom Stone Farmhouse In A Idyllic Rural Edgworth Setting
Birches Farm Cottage – A Most Unique Setting
Tucked just off Bury Road, close to the picturesque village of Edgworth, Birches Farm Cottage is a honey-hued semi-detached stone farmhouse where timeless character meets modern living. Framed by open countryside, its glass-roofed conservatory captures sweeping views across rolling fields, while the gardens – a blend of manicured lawns, vibrant borders, and stone pathways – offer peaceful corners to pause and take in the surroundings.
The approach sets the scene. A gentle climb along a farm track, edged with open green fields and drystone walls, draws you deeper into rural life. Passing through the working farmyard, the air carries the scent of hay and the occasional sound of livestock, a reminder of the home’s agricultural setting. Beyond the old stone gateposts and cattle grid, the paved driveway and integral double garage mark your arrival at this welcoming home.
Where Character Meets Comfort
Step inside the covered portico entrance into a bright, contemporary hallway, complete with a handy cloakroom cupboard and direct access to the garage. The warmth of the timber front door, the herringbone flooring, and the overall light and airy feel immediately set the tone – this is a home that respects its heritage while embracing a stylish, modern finish.
A Lounge for All Seasons
To the left lies the award-winning, magazine-featured lounge – a showpiece of style and comfort. A rustic double-sided stone fireplace with wood-burning stove anchors one wall, adding warmth and character. Soft recessed lighting casts a gentle glow over white walls, oak doors, and the stone-flagged floor that flows throughout the ground floor. Generous picture windows frame the surrounding greenery, creating a connection with the outdoors, while the spacious layout offers the flexibility for cosy evenings or larger gatherings. Integrated ceiling speakers in both the lounge and the kitchen enhance everyday living and entertaining, offering seamless, high-quality audio throughout the social heart of the home
Dining with a Sense of Occasion
The dining room is full of character, with flagstone flooring under centuries-old oak beams. The double-sided fireplace forms a striking focal point, perfect for lingering over candlelit dinners. A wide picture window overlooks the garden, bringing the changing seasons into every mealtime. Above, the double-height section reveals the oak staircase, complete with cleverly integrated storage beneath, linking the two floors with light and openness.
The Heart of the Home – Kitchen & Conservatory
The kitchen/breakfast room is designed to be both functional and inviting. Soft grey cabinetry with brushed brass handles pairs with warm wood worktops, while a range-style cooker sits beneath a concealed extractor, framed by rustic herringbone tiling. Integrated appliances include an oven, microwave, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, wine cooler, and a farmhouse-style sink perfectly placed beneath a window to take in the countryside views.
A breakfast bar seating four creates the ideal spot for casual dining, morning coffee, or catching up with friends. From here, a door opens to the conservatory – a light-filled space with glass walls and a vaulted roof that blurs the boundary between indoors and out. In summer, it’s bathed in sunshine with garden scents drifting in; in winter, the underfloor heating beneath the tiled floor keeps it warm and inviting, making it a peaceful place to watch frost settle over the fields. French doors lead directly onto the terrace.
A useful downstairs WC is located off the kitchen lobby.
The garage, also accommodates the washing machine and serves as a practical laundry area, keeping day-to-day chores neatly out of sight.
Upstairs – Four Bedrooms and Countryside Calm
The oak staircase leads to a vaulted landing filled with light from Velux windows, creating an airy welcome to the upper floor.
Bedroom One –
 The main bedroom enjoys far-reaching views from four windows, fitted wardrobes, and a feature oak-slat wall detail. The en-suite includes a double shower with glazed screen, vanity sink with mirror, WC, and marble-effect tiling to walls and floor.
Bedroom Two –
 A spacious double with a front-facing outlook, blue panelled feature wall, and built-in wardrobes.
Bedroom Three –
 Overlooking the side garden, decorated in soft pink to half height with a charming exposed beam behind the bed.
Bedroom Four –
 Currently a nursery, with a sage-painted feature wall and a view over the front.
A Bathroom Designed for Comfort and Style
The family bathroom combines practicality with a sense of luxury. Large marble-effect tiles flow from floor to ceiling, reflecting light beautifully. A wall-hung toilet, contemporary vanity with warm wood countertop, and countertop basin with chrome mixer tap set the scene. An illuminated circular mirror adds soft ambience, complemented by recessed shelving. The bath, with rainfall shower over, invites both quick refreshes and long, indulgent soaks. A chrome heated towel rail and thoughtful design touches complete the space.
Gardens and Outlook
The gardens are a perfect marriage of open space, mature planting, and uninterrupted views. Lawns sweep around the property, bordered by established shrubs, seasonal flowers, and well-tended beds. A paved terrace alongside the conservatory offers a sunny spot for morning coffee or evening drinks, while stone pathways link different seating areas.
A raised planting bed adds colour and structure, and a firepit area provides a cosy place to gather. Climbing plants soften timber and stone boundaries, while hedges offer privacy without interrupting the expansive views. From every vantage point, the rolling hills stretch into the distance – vibrant in summer, golden in autumn, and softly frosted in winter.
In the Village
Edgworth offers a thriving community with everyday essentials and a welcoming atmosphere. Within walking distance, you’ll find a post office, village shop, butcher, two cafes, a hairdresser, and a beautician. The village also boasts a cricket club, 4G football pitches, and the much-loved Holden’s & Co ice cream shop.
For dining, try the new gastropub at The Spread Eagle or the traditional charm of The White Horse and The Black Bull. Nearby Ramsbottom offers an even wider choice of restaurants and bars, just 10 minutes away.
Edgworth Primary School is rated ‘Good’ by Ofsted, with secondary options at Turton School and Canon Slade, both also rated ‘Good’. Buses also run to Bury Grammar and Bolton independent schools.
For outdoor pursuits, the scenic Wayoh and Entwistle reservoirs are close by, along with the village park. Commuters benefit from excellent road links, with the M65 just 15 minutes away, and Bolton or Bury reachable in around 20 minutes.
Important Notice for Buyers
We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only — they may not be exact or tested.
Fixtures & Fittings
Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller.
Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks
To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. We’ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage.
At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. There’s a small, non-refundable fee of £25 per person (or £50 if you’re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when you’re ready to proceed.
Please note, we can’t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete — so the sooner they’re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home.
Relationship Disclosure
In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If that’s ever the case, we’ll always let you know.
Referral Fees
We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need — such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. Sometimes we receive a small referral fee or benefit for introducing you to these providers. You’re under no obligation to use them and you’re always welcome to choose your own.

Description
The accommodation of this spacious end of terrace property comprises Lounge, Dining Room, Kitchen, 3 Bedrooms and a Family Bathroom. Externally the property is garden fronted and also benefits from a large garden to the rear aspect (some of which is not included in the deeds for the property). Our View
This property has been a happy family home for the current owners for over 60 years. During that time they have loved and cared for the property but its now the right time for a new family to take over and make it into a modern home for the next generation.
It is spacious and benefits from a garden to the rear meaning it is suitable for first time buyers either with or planning a family. It is in need of an element of modernisation but we believe it has been priced to sell and is being offered with no vendor chain attached.
Location
Denton is a Town in Greater Manchester to the East of the City centre.
Situated on the junction of the M60/M67 it is ideally located for those wishing to commute.
The Town itself has great amenities with Crown Point North shopping centre, Morrisons, Sainsbury and Lidl supermarkets, major banks, post office, library and swimming pool.
The town centre is also on the cross roads of the A57 providing access to many major bus routes for Hyde, Ashton-under-Lyne, Stockport and Manchester.
Denton also provides access to some of the best schools in Tameside both at a junior and senior school level. Other local amenities include a golf club, several cricket and football clubs as well as various churches, Conservative, Liberal and Labour clubs.

about_property:
Attractive Family Home with Spacious Interiors, Gardens, and Garage in a Convenient Location
Full Description
Tenure: Freehold
Occupying a desirable corner plot, this well-presented three-bedroom home is located in a popular residential part of Wythenshawe, offering excellent access to local amenities, reputable schools, Wythenshawe Hospital, and superb transport connections. Motorway links, the airport, and Manchester city centre are all within easy reach, making it a highly convenient choice for commuters and families alike.
Stepping inside, you are welcomed into a spacious family living room filled with natural light, enhanced by French doors opening directly onto the rear garden. This bright and inviting space is ideal for both everyday living and entertaining. The adjoining breakfast kitchen features a modern range of wall and base units, integrated oven with electric hob, space for a dishwasher, and ample room for additional appliances. There is also space for a dining table, creating a sociable area for mealtimes, with laminate flooring providing a sleek, practical finish.
Upstairs, there are three well-proportioned bedrooms, two of which are generous doubles, alongside a stylish and contemporary family bathroom.
Externally, the property enjoys both front and rear gardens. The front offers a driveway with parking for multiple vehicles, while the rear garden provides a mix of lawn and a wooden decked area—perfect for outdoor dining and summer gatherings. The property also benefits from a good-sized garage, offering excellent storage space.
This home combines a convenient location with versatile living space, making it an excellent choice for families or professionals seeking a well-connected yet comfortable place to live.
Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the size and potential of this property.

Pattinson Auction are referred to below as The Auctioneer. This auction lot is being sold under either conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer. The property is available to view strictly by appointment only via any Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between any marketing agent and The Auctioneer so that all matters can be dealt with effectively. The property is being sold via a transparent online auction. To submit a bid on any property marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders buyers must adhere to a verification of identity process in line with Anti Money Laundering procedures. Auctioneers Additional Comments
The advertised price is commonly referred to as a Starting Bid or Guide Price and is accompanied by a Reserve Price. The Reserve Price is confidential to the seller and the auctioneer and will typically be within a range above or below 10% of the Guide Price, Starting Bid. These prices are subject to change. An auction can be closed at any time with the auctioneer permitting for the property (the lot) to be sold prior to the end of the auction. A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers obligations and sellers commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.
Auctioneers Additional Comments
In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon exchange of contracts the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit equivalent to 5% of the purchase price. The deposit will form part of the purchase price. A non-refundable reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of 7,200 inc VAT) is also payable upon agreement of sale. The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price, and consideration should be given by the purchaser to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with the overall purchase costs. Both the Marketing Agent and the Auctioneer may consider it necessary or beneficial to pass customer details to third-party service suppliers, from whom a referral fee may be received. There is no requirement or obligation to use any recommended suppliers or services.

It's easy to see why The Pack Horse has proven popular with Bolton's influx of students, offering a fantastic range of on-site facilities including a fully-equipped gym and a modern common room with pool tables, pinball machines, video games and even a large projector screen for movie nights, making it incredibly easy for residents to relax, unwind and socialise. Residents also benefit from secure bicycle storage, CCTV in the communal areas, a concierge reception service and laundry facilities.
The Pack Horse is a beautiful period building that was once the prestigious Pack Horse Hotel, which was transformed in 2012 to create the ultimate boutique student living experience. Located on Bradshawgate, only a 10 minute walk away from the University of Bolton, The Pack Horse has everything that Bolton has to offer on its doorstep! Bradshawgate is home to most of Bolton's bars and restaurants, alongside the recently renovated Market Place shopping centre and the newly opened Vaults which contains numerous restaurants and high street shops. It's no surprise that The Pack Horse is one of the most sought after developments in Bolton!
The University of Bolton has around 14,000 students, with over 8,000 living and travelling from areas outside the North West region. Unlike the close neighbours of Liverpool and Manchester, virtually no Purpose-Built Student Accommodation exists in the immediate area, with a housing problem lagging some way behind the ambitious ongoing development plans of the University of Bolton. Now is the perfect time to invest in Bolton's student accommodation!
Financial Breakdown
Gross Rent: £5,060.00
Net income: £1,307.00
Gross yield: 31.63%
Net yield: 8.17%
Please contact agent for full financial breakdown.

auction sale 09 September 2025 - Leasehold eleventh and twelfth floor flat
description
Leasehold eleventh and twelfth floor flat
Location:
The property is located on Spindletree Avenue. Shopping amenities can be found locally within Manchester City Centre. Public transport links are available at Moston Train Station to the south east along with a network of local bus services serving the surrounding areas. The property is served by road links including the A6104 and M60 both lying to the north. Recreational pursuits can be found at Alkrington Woods Nature Reserve to the north west.
Accommodation:
Three bedrooms, reception room, kitchen, bathroom/wc
EPC Rating: C
Council Tax Band: B
Lease:
Held on a lease for a term of 125 years (less 10 days) from 17/03/2005.
To view:
Strictly by arrangement with the auctioneers.
Important Notice:
For each Lot, a contract documentation fee of £1,500 (inclusive of VAT) is payable to Barnard Marcus Auctions by the buyer. The seller may charge additional fees payable upon completion. If applicable, such fees are detailed within the Special Conditions of Sale. Buyers are deemed to bid in full knowledge of this.
The Guide Price quoted must not be relied upon by prospective purchasers as a valuation or assessment of value of the property. It is intended to provide purchasers with an indication of the region at which the reserve may be set at the time of going to press. The guide price may be subject to variation and interested parties are advised to make regular checks for variations and should be aware that the reserve price may be either below or above the quoted guide price.
Prospective purchasers should also be aware that the eventual sale price may be above or below the guide level dependent upon competition, and should therefore not presume the guide to be indicative of the final expected sale price or the price the property is available at.
When setting the guide price, the auctioneers have given consideration to the seller’s instructions in respect of their indicated reserve price at the time of instruction. The reserve price, (the level below which the property will not be sold), remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer. The guide price therefore, is intended to indicate the region at which the reserve price is intended to be set. The seller will confirm their final reserve price close to the auction date and if appropriate the auctioneers may adjust the guide price to reflect this.
Whilst Barnard Marcus make every effort to ensure the safety and security of viewers at properties, we have not carried out a detailed Health & Safety inspection of properties in our auctions and cannot therefore guarantee the safety and security of viewers.
Prospective purchasers and bidders attend properties entirely at their own risk. Particular care should be taken when accessing cellars, attics, exterior grounds and outbuildings and boundaries. All non-conducted inspections of vacant sites should be made in daylight hours only and entry into such sites is entirely at the viewers risk.
1. Money laundering regulations: Intending purchasers will be asked to produce identification documentation at a later stage and we would ask for your co-operation in order that there will be no delay in agreeing the sale.

General: While we endeavour to make our sales particulars fair, accurate and reliable, they are only a general guide to the property and, accordingly, if there is any point which is of particular importance to you, please contact the office and we will be pleased to check the position for you, especially if you are contemplating travelling some distance to view the property.

This generously spacious 5 bedroom home with potential to easily become 6 bedrooms, sits within exclusive courtyard surroundings in a highly sought after and locally renowned setting. With over 4,000sqft of accommodation, well laid out over 3 floors and currently configured including a top floor self-contained 1 bedroom annexe, this exceptional property is a wonderful opportunity, brought to the market for the first time in many years. It offers an outstanding chance to create an outstanding home in beautiful surroundings. Excellent gardens, triple garaging and ample off road parking complete the picture here, with the added benefit of no chain delay - Viewing Highly Recommended, Contact Us now To View.
The Starkies, Manchester Road, Bury is a 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom home with multiple reception spaces offering flexibility and ease of creating 6 bedrooms or more, within the generous accommodation of over 4,000sqft in total. Offering flexible and versatile accommodation, the property is currently configured with a self-contained 1 bedroom annexe to the upper floor. Well laid out over 3 storeys in all, living spaces at this property are a good size throughout and retained features add significantly to its appeal.
In addition to its extensive reception spaces within, there is also a lovely sun room / conservatory with beautiful outlooks over the rear garden and grounds. To the front of course, there is also ample parking within the triple garage, while driveway space is also ample too. In all, the property's curtilage is comprehensive both inside and out.
Offering an outstanding opportunity to purchase a substantial home which offers great options and versatility, while being positioned in such a locally iconic setting which is well located and within easy reach of local amenities and very highly regarded local schools, this is a genuinely unusual chance to acquire a piece of local history too, while the property also has the further benefit of being offered for sale with no chain delay - Contact our Rawtenstall office now to reserve your exclusive personal viewing. With such a great suite of features and aspects, early viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment.
Internally, this property briefly comprises:
Ground floor - Entrance Hallway with Downstairs Cloaks & WC, Lounge, Dining Room, Breakfast Kitchen, Utility Room, Conservatory, Integral Triple Garage.
First floor - Landing off to Bedroom 1 with Dressing Room & En-Suite Shower Room, Bedrooms 2 & 3, Study and Family Bathroom.
Second floor - 2nd Landing off to further Lounge, Dining Room, Kitchen, Bedroom and Jack & Jill Bathroom.
Externally, the property enjoys a generous plot which, in addition to the Integral Triple Garage, also has ample Driveway Parking for several vehicles, a Rose Garden to the front, a Side Garden and both Rear Patios and Rear Garden space too.
Set within its private stone courtyard setting, this property has parking to the front and looks out onto lovely surroundings both front and rear. The popular location is within easy reach of many shops and local amenities which Bury has to offer and of course, it is well placed for major transport links making it easy to commute into Manchester and across the North West. Highly regarded schools are also within walking distance, as are sports and leisure facilities, healthcare, entertainment and both shopping and dining options too.

Karen Ritchie Estates are delighted to be instructed with the sale of this superb family home offering a spacious and flexible living environment and ideally located on the premium post code of Albert Rd West.
The property boasts four spacious bedrooms, four reception rooms and is set upon an extensive plot offering the opportunity for substantial further development subject to relevant planning.
This imposing residence is the perfect choice for the growing or multi generation family and is positioned to take advantage of a wealth of local amenities. Heaton is regarded as one of Boltons leading residential areas and offers a number of reputable schools, both private and public, places of worship, health and fitness centres, restaurants and shopping facilities striking the perfect balance of access to the leafy outdoors coupled with an excellent transport infrastructure. Sitting on the doorstep of some beautiful semi rural surroundings to include The Doffcocker Nature Reserve, Moss Bank Parklands and the historic Smithills Hall Estate and for those who enjoy life outdoors the country parks of Rivington and The West Pennine Moors are within easy reach.
Access to the property is via an extensive driveway which will accommodate multiple vehicles and to the rear a large, well maintained garden plot offers clearly defined areas for outdoor dining relaxation and play.
Albert Road West has long been regarded as a highly desirable post code and plays host to a number of sizeable quality dwellings, whist this property would benefit from a degree of modernisation it has been maintained in excellent order and is in fully ready to occupy condition. Home to its current vendor for 45 years the time is now right to pass to new ownership to recreate that same loving family home. We strongly recommend early viewing to fully appreciate what is on offer.
Ground Floor
Entrance Hall - double glazed entrance door giving access to entrance hall comprising of radiator, useful under stairs storage, stairs to first floor and two double glazed windows.

Surrounding the Property
To the front of the property is large paved drive giving access to garage. To the rear of the property is large garden area comprising of paved patio with steps leading down to laid lawn with well stocked mature borders and a variety of plants, trees and shrubbery.

Situated in the highly sought-after area of Prestwich, this extended semi-detached property offers a perfect blend of contemporary living and traditional charm. The large dining kitchen is a focal point of the home, complete with Velux windows that flood the area with sunlight, making it the perfect spot for family meals or social gatherings and includes an integrated double oven, hob and dishwasher with ample room for table and chairs.
