title: 4 bed detached house for sale Bowdon, Altrincham, Greater Manchester WA14
about_property:
For sale by Informal Tender - 12noon 10th September
Lot 1: A detached Grade II listed four-bed farmhouse Associated Grade II listed traditional brick barn
Full residential planning for 3 units and dutch barn
Planning Number: 114988/lbc/24 (Trafford Council)
Lot 2: Farm outbuildings, storage bays, slurry lagoon and silage clamps
Substantial plot in a private, semi-rural location
The whole area extends to 3.06 acres
For sale as a whole or in two Lots - An opportunity to acquire a derelict farmhouse, brick barn with residential permission for 3 dwellings over 5005.sq.ft, Dutch barn and farm outbuildings.
Informal tender by 12 noon 10th September
For sale as a whole or in two Lots, an opportunity to acquire a farmhouse requiring modernisaiton, brick barn with residential permission for 3 dwellings over 5005.sq.ft, dutch barn and farm outbuildings in a desirable location.
Lot 1: Xs £975,000
A detached Grade II listed four-bedroom farmhouse, associated Grade II listed traditional brick barn with full residential planning for 3 dwellings over 5005sq.ft and dutch barn.
Lot 2: Tba
Farm outbuildings, storage bays, slurry lagoon and silage clamps.
Lot 1 - The Farmhouse
• The detached property is constructed of brick under a slate roof and requires a full scheme of modernisations. The accommodation offers good sized and well-proportioned space over 2 floors. On the ground floor are three reception rooms, a kitchen, shower room, and boiler/utility room. Upstairs there are four bedrooms and a bathroom.
The Barns
• A Planning Application has been approved under Section 19 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 to amend the approved proposals for the conversion of a traditional agricultural building into three residential dwellings (Ref: 106995/lbc/22).
• The original scheme, which was granted with Listed Building Consent, includes the sensitive restoration and conversion of the building into three characterful homes (Use Class C3), along with associated external works, private amenity space, and parking provision. The project also involves the removal of more modern structures on the site, including a steel-framed agricultural building, a shed, and a car port, relocating two of the approved parking spaces to better integrate with the site layout and heritage context, enhancing the landscaping scheme, with additional planting to further soften the development and support local biodiversity
Lot 2 - The Farm Buildings
• Complementing the traditional features of the property is a range of modern agricultural buildings positioned alongside a slurry lagoon and well-constructed silage clamps. These facilities are currently in use by a farming tenant under a Farm Business Tenancy, which is set to conclude in September 2025. These are available by separate negotiation.
Situation
Bow Green Farm is situated in Bowdon, a leafy suburb of Altrincham within the borough of Trafford. While in a rural setting, it is within a 5-7 minute drive of Hale Village and Altrincham town centre, both of which offer a good range of independent shops, bars and restaurants, as well as several supermarkets.
Bowdon’s close proximity to the M56 motorway makes it an ideal location for commuting to Manchester, while the tram connection into Manchester is only 10 minutes away, offering a less stressful route to the city centre.
Bowdon village is host to many sporting/leisure activities including cricket, tennis and squash, all based at the nearby sports club. Dunham Golf Club is within a five-minute drive. For those looking for a more leisurely stroll, Dunham Massey estate, with its impressive gardens and deer park, is just 10 minutes away.
On the educational front, there are three primary schools in Bowdon, and the highly rated Altrincham Grammar

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale Fairview Avenue, Manchester, Lancashire M34
about_property:
A Rare Opportunity to Own a Beautifully Presented, Spacious Three-Bedroom Semi-Detached Home on the Ever-Desirable Fairview Avenue, Dane Bank – With Stunning Garden, Detached Garage & Huge Potential
Welcome to Fairview Avenue, one of Dane Bank’s most sought-after residential streets – where homes rarely come to market. This impressive three-bedroom semi-detached property is a true gem, offering spacious, stylish living with an abundance of charm, curb appeal, and potential.
From the moment you arrive, the home’s exterior makes a lasting impression. The immaculately kept front garden, double driveway, and detached garage with electric set the tone for what lies beyond – a property that’s been lovingly maintained and thoughtfully designed both inside and out.
Step inside to a large and welcoming hallway, providing a warm and elegant entrance. The living room stretches the full length of the house, creating a generous and inviting space for relaxing or entertaining. With a beautiful bay window to the front and French doors opening out to the rear garden, the room is bathed in natural light throughout the day.
Off the hallway, you’ll also find a separate dining room, ideal for formal meals or a flexible second reception space. The modern kitchen is both stylish and practical, offering access to the rear garden and plenty of storage and workspace.
Upstairs, the property continues to impress with three generously sized bedrooms. The primary bedroom, positioned at the front, boasts another elegant bay window and built-in wardrobes, while the second double bedroom, overlooking the garden, also features ample fitted storage. The third bedroom is surprisingly spacious and can accommodate a double bed, though it currently works well as a large single or home office.
A key highlight of the first floor is the expansive family bathroom, complete with both a full-sized bath and a separate shower enclosure, providing comfort and practicality for busy households. The WC is housed separately, a convenient layout for families.
Outside, the beautifully landscaped rear garden offers a peaceful retreat or a vibrant entertaining space. Whether you’re a keen gardener, enjoy outdoor gatherings, or have children who need space to play, this garden ticks all the boxes. The detached garage provides excellent additional storage or workspace potential.
For those seeking future flexibility, the generous plot size offers fantastic scope for extension (subject to planning permission), making this an excellent long-term family home.
Located just a short walk from local shops, amenities, and the stunning Reddish Vale Nature Reserve, this home enjoys a prime position in Dane Bank. With excellent transport links to Manchester, Stockport, and the wider M60 network, and within catchment for well-regarded local schools, the location is ideal for families, professionals, and commuters alike.
Properties on Fairview Avenue are rarely available – don’t miss your chance to make this stunning home your own. Early viewing is highly recommended

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale Mount Street, Denton M34
about_property:
Three Double Bedrooms
En-suite With Roll Top Bath
Parking
Enclosed Rear Yard
Balcony
Viewing Essential!
Level access
This unique and deceptively spacious three double bedroom terrace property is full of character and charm, offering versatile living space ideal for families, professionals, or those looking for something a little different. Tucked away on an un-adopted road, the property is conveniently close to a range of local amenities, excellent transport links, and the picturesque Haughton Dale Nature Reserve, where scenic river and woodland walks can be enjoyed, offering a wonderful balance of town and nature.
Stepping inside, the home immediately impresses with its generous room sizes and thoughtful layout. The spacious lounge is a welcoming space, featuring a log burner that creates a cosy and homely atmosphere. There is a separate sitting room that opens into the dining area, creating an open plan feel ideal for entertaining or family life, while the kitchen offers a practical and well-laid-out space with ample storage and workspace for day-to-day cooking, access to spacious and versatile cellar.
Upstairs, there are three well-proportioned double bedrooms, all offering comfortable and flexible accommodation. The master bedroom benefits from French doors opening onto a decked balcony, providing a peaceful outdoor spot to enjoy a morning coffee or evening sunset. The master also boasts its own stylish en-suite bathroom complete with a freestanding roll top bath, adding a touch of luxury. A separate modern shower room serves the remaining bedrooms.
Externally, the property offers off-road parking to the front along with a low maintenance gravelled garden that wraps around to the side. To the rear, the enclosed yard has been attractively designed with artificial grass and a paved pathway for easy upkeep, creating a private and practical area for outdoor seating or children to play. There is also gated access for added security and convenience.
With its distinctive character and generous proportions, this home is truly a rare find and and must be viewed!

about_property:

A beautifully appointed ground floor apartment in superb condition throughout enjoying a large private terrace, providing the type of external space that is rarely found in an apartment. Importantly, the property is offered for sale with only vacant possession, and no further upward chain delay, so it is hoped a prompt completion can be arranged when the sale is agreed.
Situated in a stone building and being part of the much admired Deakins Park development, in Egerton, the setting is wonderful. Eagley Brook river runs near by and the waterfall can be seen from the grounds of the development. There is beautiful countryside and woodland nearby offering wonderful opportunities to explore the countryside. There are superb every day amenities, including; restaurants (Ciao Baby, Cibo, Thomas Egerton etc) sports clubs (Delph Sailing Club, Dunscar Golf Club, and The Last Drop Village), the wonderful Rainy’s is just a short walk away and there are superb transport links within easy reach by both road and railway as Bromley Cross railway station is within easy reach which directly serves; Manchester, Salford, Bolton and Blackburn.
The superbly appointed accommodation extends to around 957 ft.² and briefly comprises: Welcoming reception hall with built-in storage space, open plan, lounge/diner with tall windows and door off to the private terrace, the lounge/diner opens directly into the modern professionally, fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, there is a separate utility space, the Master bedroom is over 6.3 m in length with fitted triple size wardrobe and luxurious en suite shower room off. The second bedroom is over 5 m in length and the bathroom suite is particularly well appointed. Externally there is a sizable private terrace area that you step out onto from the lounge part of which is covered. There is allocated car parking.
The property is fully double glazed, including feature windows which revolve around for easy cleaning, there is an electric heating and hot water system, video entrance, telephone, and importantly, the property is available with no further upward chain delay.

Detailed Description
Located on the ever-popular Rectory Road in Garswood, this three-bedroom detached property represents an exceptional opportunity for those with vision, creativity, and a passion for transformation. In need of a full back-to-brick renovation throughout, the home offers endless potential either as a rewarding development project or the foundation for creating a truly bespoke family residence. The generous plot and well-proportioned rooms provide an excellent canvas, with the current ground floor layout comprising a porch, welcoming entrance hall, kitchen, dining room, living room, and a versatile downstairs bedroom. Upstairs, there are two spacious double bedrooms and a bathroom. Outside, the property enjoys gardens to both the front and rear, a driveway providing off-road parking, and a single garage.
Due to the property’s condition, it is unlikely that traditional mortgage finance will be available, and we strongly recommend viewing the virtual tour before arranging a physical visit. Garswood itself is a desirable residential area within Ashton-in-Makerfield, cherished for its close-knit community, well-regarded local schools, and excellent access to open green spaces. For commuters, the location is superb - Garswood Train Station is just moments away, and the M6 motorway is within easy reach, offering swift connections to Liverpool, Manchester, and beyond. This is a rare chance to acquire a property with such scope in one of the area’s most sought-after locations.

With a generous extension to the rear, this immaculately presented three bedroom semi-detached enjoys a large corner plot on a pleasant cul-de-sac.
Located on Lilac Grove in Moston, the property is situated around just 5 miles outside of the Manchester city cente and with it's contemporary layout and impeccable finish, it's a true turnkey property ideal for family buyers.
With driveway parking a detached garage, the property boasts a stunning tiered back garden with a patio seating area leading up to neatly manicured lawns and tidy flower beds ; a perfect outdoor retreat for anyone needing that relaxing private space or with children and pets!
Internally there is a welcoming entrance hallway which leads into a substantial lounge. This flows open-plan into the extended kitchen-dining room. Here you will find a quality modern fitted kitchen with a large island, integrated appliances and ample natural light from the Bi-Folding doors and Velux windows. There is also a handy pantry space just off the kitchen. To the first floor meanwhile you will find three bedrooms - two doubles and one single - with a beautiful bathroom suite completing the accommodation.
The property is well serviced by the local amenities. Nearby, there are several well regarded schools including St Matthew's rc High School within walking distance and the Ofsted 'Outstanding' St Margaret Mary's rc Primary while there are pleasant outdoor spaces such as Broadhurst Park just round the corner. The M60 motorway is within 1 mile with the nearby Moston station providing excellent commuter links.

Situated on one of Worsley’s most popular and well-regarded roads, it enjoys a highly desirable location close to excellent schools, local shops, and superb transport links, making it an ideal choice for families seeking both comfort and convenience.
Upon entering, you are welcomed into a bright and inviting hallway that immediately sets the tone for the space within. The ground floor offers two separate and beautifully proportioned reception rooms – one perfect for use as a formal lounge, the other lending itself to a cosy family room or playroom, depending on your needs.
To the rear of the home lies the heart of the property: A stunning, extended open-plan kitchen and family room. Thoughtfully designed with both style and functionality in mind, this space features modern fitted units, integrated appliances, and ample room for a large dining table and additional seating area, creating a wonderful environment for entertaining guests or enjoying everyday family life. Upstairs, the generous proportions continue. Externally, the property provides a driveway to the front, ensuring off-road parking, and to the rear you will find a substantial garden. This private outdoor space combines a neat lawn and a raised decking area.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale Poplar Grove, Sale M33
about_property:
Immaculately Presented Period End Terrace
Substantially Extended Throughout and Sympathetically Restored
Accommodation over Four Floors
Highly Sought After Location Close to Sale Town Centre
Four Bedrooms
Converted Cellar Chamber providing Further Living Accommodation
A stunning example of a meticulously enhanced, immaculately appointed and substantially extended period residence, with sympathetically restored and contemporary themed accommodation over four floors of just over 1,700 sq ft. Boasting four double bedrooms and three bath/shower rooms, and a striking remodeled and refitted dining kitchen. With a large landscaped rear garden, set on the revered Poplar Grove, only a short stroll to Sale, popular schools including Sale Grammar, both St Joseph's and Springfield Primary, and two Metrolink stops.
Description
A handsome traditional, bay-fronted period end-terraced, having been comprehensively enhanced and intelligently improved to offer an outstanding example of an exceptional versatile residence over four floors. Enjoying a stylish blend of contemporary themed improvements and sympathetic enhancements, with a large landscaped garden, and occupying a much sought-after location.
Upon approach the home enjoys a charming frontage, with bay-fronted twin-tone brick elevations, a mature feature tree in a stone topped brick planter, and a block paved driveway leading to the elevated entrance. A striking stained glass rich front door sets the tone for the exceptional period home. Opening to a fabulous and welcoming entrance hall, a single door leads to the extensive open plan ground floor, with a bay-fronted living room with in-built alcove storage to the front, and a central dining room with attractive wooden flooring. A large opening leads to the intelligently remodelled and extended dining kitchen, providing a vast family/entertaining area with a striking refitted quality kitchen, a feature central island with breakfast bar, enjoying quartz work surfaces and contrasting tones. Crittal-style double doors to the garden, charming picture-frame window, and vaulted ceiling with multiple skylights. Off the dining room is a staircase to the basement and a useful cloakroom storage cupboard which houses plumbing for a ground floor w/c.
The basement level is a special addition to the home, having been converted and also excavated to offer improved head height. The main chamber provides for a large versatile bay-fronted reception room/ home office or even occasional bedroom, whilst there is also a modern refitted separate shower room.
Location
The friendly town of Sale is an extremely popular place to live, thanks to easy transport links into Media City, Manchester City Centre and other neighbouring areas via three Metrolink stations. The nearby North West motorway network and Manchester International Airport are also conveniently located nearby. Sale and the surrounding areas are also very desirable locations for families, due to the large number of highly regarded schools in the vicinity. Both Sale and nearby Altrincham can also provide for all shopping and recreational needs and one of Europe's largest shopping centres, The Trafford Centre can be found only a few miles away.

title: 3 bed detached house for sale Porcelain Street, Worsley, Manchester M28
about_property:
Freehold new build
No chain – perfect for a smooth and speedy purchase.
Spacious lounge
Stylish kitchen/diner
Three generous double bedrooms
Contemporary family bathroom
Private rear garden
Prime Walkden location
Freehold – No Chain – Modern New Build in Prime Walkden Location
This stylish and energy-efficient three-bedroom detached home is newly built and ready to move straight into, offering a perfect blend of modern design, comfort, and convenience. Ideally located just a 10-minute walk from Walkden train station (with direct 18-minute trains to Manchester), plus excellent links to the M60, A580, and guided bus routes to Leigh, Tyldesley, and Salford, it’s an ideal choice for first-time buyers, young families, or professionals.
A bright hallway with dark wooden flooring sets the tone for the property’s modern style and leads to the downstairs WC, finished with light grey tiling. On the right-hand side, the spacious and airy lounge is filled with natural light from a large bay window and features cream carpets for a warm, cosy feel. On the left-hand side, the kitchen/diner is fitted with white cupboard doors, dark grey countertops, and cream tiled flooring. It includes an integrated oven and grill, gas hob, and cooker hood, with space for a washer/dryer and a freestanding fridge-freezer. The dining area opens through patio doors to the rear garden, offering a pleasant view and an easy indoor-outdoor flow.
Upstairs, the landing leads to three generously sized double bedrooms, one currently used as a home office. The master bedroom benefits from an en-suite bathroom with a walk-in shower, tiled from floor to ceiling for easy maintenance. The family bathroom is decorated in a similar style and features a bath with overhead shower.
The rear garden combines a paved patio and lawn area, fully enclosed with fencing for privacy—perfect for relaxing or entertaining. The property also benefits from a private double driveway. Families will appreciate being within the catchment area for Hilton Lane Primary School (Good) and St Andrew’s Methodist Primary School (Outstanding), with Worsley College and Manchester’s universities just a short drive away.
This immaculate freehold home with no onward chain offers comfort, style, and a sought-after location—viewing is highly recommended.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale Butt Hill Avenue, Manchester M25
about_property:
Prestigious prestwich location
Four spacious bedrooms
Two versatile reception rooms

Ground floor cloakroom
Detached single garage
Close to schools and amenities

View our 360 tour
Schedule a viewing 24/7 via the brochure
A Substantial Four-Bedroom Family Home in a Prestigious Prestwich Location
Set on one of Prestwich’s most desirable residential avenues, this impressive semi-detached home offers space, character and flexibility for modern family living. With four bedrooms, two reception rooms, a separate garage and a prime location close to excellent schools and local amenities, it is the perfect blend of comfort and convenience.
From the moment you step into the welcoming porch and hallway, the generous proportions are immediately apparent. The front lounge is light-filled and elegant, providing the ideal setting for relaxing with family or hosting guests. Two dining spaces offer versatile options – a cosy everyday area adjacent to the kitchen, and a larger, more formal dining room perfect for entertaining. A ground floor cloakroom adds further practicality to the layout.
Upstairs, the home’s four bedrooms offer a variety of uses. Two are substantial enough to serve as the principal bedroom, while the remaining rooms are well-suited for guests, children or a dedicated home office. The family bathroom is centrally located to serve all rooms with ease.
The property also benefits from a separate garage, ideal for secure parking or additional storage, and sits within a mature residential setting renowned for its peaceful atmosphere and strong community spirit.
Prestwich is a vibrant and highly sought-after area of Greater Manchester, known for its tree-lined streets, excellent schooling and an array of independent shops, cafes and restaurants. Local parks and green spaces are within easy reach, and excellent transport links – including nearby rail connections – ensure Manchester city centre is just a short journey away.
This is a rare opportunity to secure a substantial home in an outstanding location, offering both the space and the lifestyle that many buyers are seeking.

title: 2 bed semi-detached bungalow for sale Chequer Lane, Upholland WN8
about_property:
Former three bedroom
Semi detached bungalow
Spacious lounge
Two double bedrooms
Dining room & Kitchen
Gated driveway to the rear
Good-sized garden
Close to local amenities
Close to motorway connections
No Chain
This detached bungalow, once three bedrooms and now converted into a two-bedroom layout by extending the lounge, offers a fantastic opportunity for anyone looking to put their own stamp on a property. While the home is in need of renovation, the spacious rooms and well-planned layout make it an appealing project in a highly convenient location.
Situated close to motorway connections and just a short drive or walk into Upholland, you’ll have easy access to all essential amenities. There’s even a small council-owned pond across the road, perfect for fishing.
The accommodation comprises an entrance hall leading to a dining room at the front of the property and a kitchen with access to the side. There are two store rooms and a bathroom off the inner hallway. The two double bedrooms both have fitted wardrobes, and the large lounge—created by extending into what was previously a third bedroom—offers an impressive main living area with plenty of natural light.
Outside, the bungalow benefits from a gated driveway to the rear, which is typically used as the main entrance, and this leads directly onto the main road. There’s also a shed for storage, and the garden offers plenty of scope for landscaping to your taste.
With its generous plot, flexible layout, and desirable location, this property is ideal for those seeking a renovation project with real potential.
Auctioneer Comments
This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction allowing the buyer and seller to complete within a 56 Day Reservation
Period. Interested parties’ personal data will be shared with the Auctioneer (iamsold Ltd).
If considering a mortgage, inspect and consider the property carefully with your lender before bidding. A Buyer Information
Pack is provided, which you must view before bidding. The buyer is responsible for the Pack fee. For the most recent
information on the Buyer Information Pack fee, please contact the iamsold team.
The buyer signs a Reservation Agreement and makes payment of a Non-Refundable Reservation Fee of 4.5% of the purchase
price inc VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,600 inc. VAT. This Fee is paid to reserve the property to the buyer during the
Reservation Period and is paid in addition to the purchase price. The Fee is considered within calculations for stamp duty.
Services may be recommended by the Agent/Auctioneer in which they will receive payment from the service provider if the
service is taken. Payment varies but will be no more than £960 inc. VAT. These services are optional.

Location
Poynton is a vibrant village renowned for its independent shops, bars and restaurant's which are all centrally based around Park Lane. The village is also home to Waitrose, Morrisons and Aldi supermarkets which are complemented by other popular names such as Costa Coffee and Pizza express. There are many based community events such as the annual show and the Poynton village 10K. The area borders Lyme Park and the Peak District, and is home to many stunning Country Walks and Cycle Paths along The Middlewood Way and Poynton Canal. The Railway Station offers regular access to the city of Manchester, along with major towns of Stockport, Macclesfield and shopping centres in Handforth Dean and Cheadle Royal. Manchester International Airport is a 10 minute drive from Poynton centre accessed via the new A555 relief road, and access routes to all Motorways are easily accessible. All schools in the area both primary and secondary have excellent reputations.

about_property:
This modern spacious first-floor apartment presents an excellent opportunity for both first-time buyers or buy to let investors. One of the standout features of this flat is the allocated parking. The location is particularly advantageous, with the metro link just a short stroll away, allowing for seamless travel into Manchester City Centre and beyond. Additionally, the property enjoys easy access to Manchester Airport, Shops and the retail park.
This apartment combines modern living with practicality, with a spacious hallway which leads to two bedrooms, A large four piece bathroom and a large open plan living room kitchen. The property has been finished to a high standard throughout, There are communal areas with lift access with a main entrance which leads out into the car park.
A viewing is highly recommended! Don't miss the opportunity to view.
This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction, meaning the buyer and seller are to Complete within 56 days (the "Reservation Period"). Interested parties personal data will be shared with the Auctioneer (iamsold).
If considering buying with a mortgage, inspect and consider the property carefully with your lender before bidding.
A Buyer Information Pack is provided. The winning bidder will pay £349.00 including VAT for this pack which you must view before bidding.
The buyer signs a Reservation Agreement and makes payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.5% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,600.00 including VAT. This is paid to reserve the property to the buyer during the Reservation Period and is paid in addition to the purchase price. This is considered within calculations for Stamp Duty Land Tax.
Services may be recommended by the Agent or Auctioneer in which they will receive payment from the service provider if the service is taken. Payment varies but will be no more than £450.00. These services are optional.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale Willow Bank, Cheadle Hulme SK8
about_property:

Set in a quiet cul-de-sac on Willow Bank, this four-bedroom home has a warm and welcoming feel from the moment you arrive.
The driveway offers plenty of space for off-road parking and stepping through the porch into the generous entrance hall, you’ll instantly get a sense of the space and light that runs throughout the property.
Downstairs, the layout works perfectly for family life. The open-plan kitchen and dining area is a real heart-of-the-home space – somewhere to gather over breakfast or host a lively dinner with friends. The large lounge feels inviting and comfortable, ideal for cosy evenings in. There’s also a handy downstairs W/C, a separate utility room to keep things organised, and access to the garage, which is large enough to accommodate a car as well as provide extra storage or hobby space. The garage also features a fitted EV charging point, making it ready for electric vehicle owners.
Upstairs, there are four well-proportioned bedrooms, offering plenty of flexibility whether you need family rooms, guest space, or a home office. Two of the bedrooms benefit from fitted wardrobes, adding to the home’s excellent storage. The large family bathroom features a four-piece suite, providing both a bath and a separate shower. For anyone needing even more storage, the fully boarded loft is a huge bonus – ideal for keeping everything neatly out of sight but close to hand.
The location is hard to beat. Willow Bank sits within the catchment for some of Cheadle Hulme’s most sought-after schools, making it a great choice for families. The garden is another highlight – a generous space with a lovely decked area, perfect for summer get-togethers or simply enjoying a quiet morning coffee. With local shops, parks, and excellent transport links all close by, this is a home that offers both convenience and a sense of community.

Description
Nestled in the heart of a peaceful residential cul-de-sac on Chasetown Close, Baguley, this immaculately presented three-bedroom semi-detached home is offered for sale with no chain, making it the ideal opportunity for families, first-time buyers or those looking to upsize with minimal hassle. Priced at £299,950, this thoughtfully extended property boasts a wealth of contemporary features and is ready for immediate occupation.
The accommodation is generously proportioned throughout and impressively configured to suit modern living. A standout feature is the bespoke open-plan dining kitchen, fitted to a high standard and offering a stylish and functional heart of the home ? Perfect for entertaining or relaxed family meals. The bright and welcoming reception room to the front offers a cosy yet spacious retreat. Upstairs, the property comprises three good-sized bedrooms, each offering ample space for furnishings and storage, while the modern family bathroom is finished to an excellent specification.
To the rear, a secluded garden provides a wonderfully private outdoor space ideal for children, pets or leisurely summer evenings. The property is located in a quiet and well-regarded neighbourhood, within walking distance to a range of local amenities including independent shops, major supermarkets, and schools rated well by Ofsted. Families will appreciate the close proximity to parkland and leisure facilities, while those commuting will benefit from the nearby Brooklands Tram Stop and Timperley village ? Both just a short walk away.
Wythenshawe Hospital is conveniently located close by, offering comprehensive healthcare services, and Manchester Airport can be reached in under 15 minutes by car, making this a prime location for professionals who travel regularly. Excellent transport links, including rail connections from nearby Altrincham or Manchester Airport stations, ensure easy access to central Manchester and beyond.
With its stylish interior, spacious layout and sought-after position, this delightful home should not be missed. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the quality and location on offer.

display_address: Victory Grove, Audenshaw, Manchester, Greater Manchester M34
title: 3 bed detached house for sale Victory Grove, Audenshaw, Manchester, Greater Manchester M34
address: Victory Grove, Audenshaw, Manchester, Greater Manchester M34
about_property:
Welcome to Victory Grove in Audenshaw. A highly sought-after location, home to an array of beautiful properties and set on a quiet estate with no through access, keeping traffic and disturbance to a minimum.
This stunning three-bedroom detached home occupies a generous plot and instantly captivates with its exceptional kerb appeal. The front driveway/garden is beautifully maintained and provides ample parking for up to 4 cars, while the modern grey frontage, complementary rendered exterior, and stylish entrance door combine to create a sleek, contemporary look that speaks of the care and attention to detail lavished on this property. Stepping inside, the same level of thought and refinement is immediately apparent. The welcoming entrance hallway sets the tone for the rest of the home, offering space for guests to be greeted and for coats and shoes to be neatly stored in a well-lit and useful under-stairs storage space while serving as a central hub connecting the stairs and the main ground floor rooms which have been stylishly laid in luxury vinyl flooring seamlessly flowing through the ground floor space.
The lounge is an inviting and versatile space, bathed in natural light from two tall windows and offering flexibility in layout thanks to its generous proportions, all while providing a charming view of the private rear garden. The second reception room, currently used as a dining area and bar and with well-designed, floor-to-ceiling storage cupboards along one wall, is another adaptable space that could be tailored to suit a variety of needs—whether as a formal dining room, home office, playroom, or additional entertaining area. The kitchen, truly the heart of the home, exudes elegance and practicality in equal measure, with premium features including concealed pop-up outlets, a Quooker tap, exquisite work surfaces, and top-quality finishes that make it ideal for both everyday family life and entertaining. A conveniently located downstairs WC, maintained to the same immaculate standard as the rest of the property, completes the ground floor.
Upstairs, three double bedrooms await. The master bedroom offers a sense of luxury with its spacious layout, bespoke fitted storage that surrounds the bed, and high-end touches such as matching hardware and integrated lighting, all while comfortably accommodating a king-size bed without compromising space. The second bedroom is equally generous, boasting extensive built-in storage across two walls, while the third bedroom, currently used as a home office, offers ample flexibility to serve as a bedroom, nursery, playroom, or home gym. The family bathroom continues the home’s premium feel, presenting a bright, modern design with a shower unit, toilet, and sink basin in a high-quality finish.
To the rear, the enclosed garden is an oasis of both relaxation and entertainment. The landscaped design reflects the same attention to detail as the interior, with durable surfacing matching the wraparound driveway for year-round usability. A summer house, canopied seating area, and a beautifully presented hot tub setup make this the perfect space for hosting or enjoying quiet evenings outdoors. For keen gardeners, the vibrant planting offers plenty of opportunity for enjoyment, while the garage provides a dry, well-finished space with plentiful electrical outlets—ideal for storage, hobbies, or as a practical workspace.
Situated within close proximity to Fairfield train station, multiple tram stops, bus links, and excellent motorway access, this home is perfectly positioned for commuters. The area also benefits from great school catchments, local supermarkets, and shopping centres, offering convenience in abundance. Presented in turnkey condition with a premium finish throughout, this property represents a rare opportunity to purchase a truly high-end home in a prime location. Viewings are strictly by appointment through Bridgfords on .

Spacious loft conversion forming a luxurious principal suite
Two reception rooms for versatile family living and entertaining

Elegant Five-Bedroom Detached Home with Spacious Interiors, Generous Parking & Private Gardens
This beautifully presented five-bedroom detached residence combines modern comforts with a versatile layout, making it an ideal choice for families seeking space, style, and convenience. With two reception rooms, three bathrooms, a well-designed kitchen, and excellent outdoor space, this home offers everything needed for contemporary living.
Step into a bright and welcoming hallway that sets the tone for the property’s generous proportions. To the front, the lounge provides a warm and comfortable retreat, perfect for relaxing with family or friends. At the rear, the separate dining room is ideal for entertaining and family meals, with French doors opening directly to the garden. The kitchen is thoughtfully designed, offering ample storage, generous worktop space, and a practical layout for busy households. A convenient downstairs WC completes the ground floor.
The first-floor hosts four generously sized double bedrooms, one with its own en-suite shower room, plus a stylishly finished family bathroom. Each room offers flexibility to suit your lifestyle—whether as bedrooms, home offices, or guest accommodation.
The top floor is dedicated to the impressive principal suite, created through a high-quality loft conversion. This expansive space boasts a luxurious double bedroom, sleek en-suite, and a peaceful ambience, making it the perfect private sanctuary.
To the front, a neat lawn enhances the home’s kerb appeal, while a generous driveway offers parking for up to three vehicles and leads to a small garage, ideal for storage or hobbies. The rear garden is a true highlight—spacious, private, and well-maintained, with a mix of lawn and patio areas. With direct access from both the lounge and dining room, it’s perfect for entertaining, play, or quiet moments outdoors.
Situated in a desirable residential cul-de-sac, the property benefits from excellent local schools, green spaces, and a friendly community atmosphere. Shops, supermarkets, and leisure facilities are within easy reach, while strong transport links provide quick access to surrounding towns and the city centre, ensuring the best of both convenience and tranquillity.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both any marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.
The property is being sold via a transparent online auction.
In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures. Bids can be submitted at any time and from anywhere.
Our verification process is in place to ensure that aml procedure are carried out in accordance with the law.
The advertised price is commonly referred to as a ‘Starting Bid’ or ‘Guide Price’ and is accompanied by a ‘Reserve Price’. The ‘Reserve Price’ is confidential to the seller and the auctioneer and will typically be within a range above or below 10% of the ‘Guide Price’ / ‘Starting Bid’.
These prices are subject to change.
An auction can be closed at any time with the auctioneer permitting for the property (the lot) to be sold prior to the end of the auction.
A
Legal Pack
associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers’ obligations and sellers’ commitments.
It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.
Auctioneers Additional Comments
In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon exchange of contracts the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit equivalent to 5% of the purchase price of the property. The deposit will be a contribution to the purchase price. A non-refundable reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of £7,200 inc VAT) is also required to be paid upon agreement of sale. The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs.
Both the Marketing Agent and The Auctioneer may believe necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass their details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or indeed obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale Mossley Road, Ashton-Under-Lyne OL6
about_property:
No Vendor Chain
Three Bedrooms

Selling a three bedroom mid-terraced property with no vendor chain, ideally situated in a convenient and sought-after area of Ashton-under-Lyne. This well-positioned home offers the perfect blend of comfort, practicality, and location, making it an attractive choice for first-time buyers, professionals, families, or investors.
Enjoying a prime setting, the property is within walking distance of Tameside Hospital and the picturesque Stamford Park — ideal for weekend walks and outdoor activities. Ashton-under-Lyne town centre is just a short stroll away, offering a fantastic range of shops, cafés, restaurants, and essential amenities. Excellent transport links are close at hand, including easy access to the motorway network and nearby train and bus services, making commuting into Manchester and surrounding areas quick and convenient. The property also falls within the catchment area for well-regarded local schools.
Set back from the road, the home benefits from a welcoming frontage with a double block-paved driveway providing ample off-road parking. Inside, the ground floor features a hallway leading to a comfortable lounge and a spacious kitchen/diner — perfect for both everyday meals and entertaining guests. Upstairs, there are three well-proportioned bedrooms, offering flexible space for sleeping, working from home, or creating a hobby room, along with a family bathroom.
To the rear, the property boasts an enclosed paved patio garden with gated access, offering a private, low-maintenance outdoor retreat.
This property offers a fantastic opportunity for those seeking a well-connected home in Ashton-under-Lyne. **Viewing Highly Recommended**

about_property:

***no chain*** Situated on a highly sought after road just off beech road, a truly delightful two bedroom end terrace period property providing spacious and light accommodation throughout. This splendid property, having been recently refurbished by the current owners, is offered for sale with no onward chain and in move-in condition. With many original features throughout, such as the wooden flooring and fireplaces, this property will prove ideal for a young couple, first time buyers or buy to let investors alike. Located only a stone's throw from the vibrant scene of Beech Road, all local amenities in Chorlton Village, local parks and the Metro, this wonderful end of terrace further benefits a well proportioned landscaped rear garden and is not one to be missed. The spacious accommodation briefly comprises: Covered porch, entrance hallway, lounge with bay window and original wooden flooring and fireplace opening through to the dining room, modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances. To the first floor there are two well proportioned bedrooms and refitted shower room, with a three piece suite and tiled walls and floor. Externally, a walled garden can be seen to the front of the property whilst to the rear, a superb landscaped garden with raised wooden deck, decorative gravel and raised beds with wooden boundaries. Double glazing and gas central heating are both installed throughout and an internal viewing is most highly recommended. Council Tax: B. EPC: D
